PDX - DUBPoints positifs : Great equipment. Decent entertainment, sparsely filled cabin. Seat change to isle request before boarding readily made with no fuss. I noticed that passengers could actually make out pa announcements both at PDX and in flight. Doesn’t bother me anymore when I can’t but can be very concerning to anyone who rarely flies. Never understood going to the trouble of making announcements both pre-boarding & on-board pre-flight, that no one can even make out. That was not an issue here. Points négatifs : Better lumbar support is always appreciated, adjustable lumbar would be very nice and could make or break an entire flight. No seat on any flight should ever be even the slightest ill repaired. Again, this equipmemt all seemed great. Lastly, since I prefer to always have a water, coke or coffe and or snack in front of me during entire flight, a bit of self serve (grab a water, coffee or snack yourself without having to make staff work a simple task would be nice on every flight. The flight from SEA-DUB was basically great and equipment is always of the utmost importantance.

Not sure there's a whole lot to do about it besides buy prepackaged food that don't have meat, vegtabjes or fruit. Protien bars may have worked. 

We brought two bottles of water each from the terminal. I could have used more, even with the drink service. 

The flight attendants we're having thier own personal conversation while passing out food and ran by when it came to the final trash clean up. When I got up to use the facilities I tried throwing my trash away but was ignored by a crew member while she was resting.

Worst Customer ServicePoints positifs : I liked the service once we left Dublin but once it was time to arrive to Leeds everything went downhill. Points négatifs : Our flight did not land to Leeds but to Manchester. I thought this would not be an issue to get my connecting flight to London. As I tried to explain to the airline attendants about my connecting flight they had no idea what was going on and said it wasn't their issue I would have to go to Leeds and explain to them what was happening. I asked if there was a way we could call them and see if I could just get a flight to London from Manchester. They said no. I tried to get a number to call myself still nothing. They sent everyone from the flight onto a coach bus to Leeds. Once I arrived to Leeds, I spoke with Ben and explained my situation. He said there were no more flights to London or anywhere near there. And there wasn't any flights to Austin, TX which was my end point either. He explained there wasn't anything they could do except fly me in the morning to London. I agreed but then come to find out he had to send me back to Manchester. Now I had already had my arrangements to stay in London for the night so I did not have much money left. He said they would take care of the accommodations and the flight to London. I was VERY PATIENT. Within this he was telling me how close they were to closing. I explained I needed everything in place before they even left because I was traveling alone in an unknown country or city. He arranged a cab to take me back to Manchester and a hotel to stay in with dinner and breakfast available. I thought everything would get better but of course it didn't. Ben clearly knew I had my checked bag and carry on. When I'm about to board the flight to London they charged me 60 pounds for my CHECKED BAG. Now this was already included on flight to begin with if all of this had not happened. The attendant did not want to listen to my story and kept passing me to another attendant that said there's nothing they could do. I had to pay since I couldn't leave my belongings. Once i arrived to London. I had to get my bag and RECHECK IN MY BAG. AGAIN they tried to charge me for my checked bag. This time I had enough of your airline and explained it was all included in my flight and I went on a rant with the attendant. He just stared and printed out the ticket for my bag. Didn't look at the computer. Didn't even explain why it's all of sudden taken care of that I don't have to pay anymore. I had no patience to hear his excuse but just wanted to get back home. This has been the worst experience I have ever had with an airline. Frontier isn't even this unorganized. Shouldn't there be a process for these kind of situations already?

Points positifs : Flight on timePoints négatifs : Upon check in Dublin there was only one attendant at the check in counter in business class. Had seat assigned when I booked the flight and check in counter gave different seats so was not sitting beside my husband.

Points positifs : It was easy to check in and everything was on time.

Awful and costly Points positifs : NothingPoints négatifs : We were informed that our flights did not exist upon arriving to the airport on our honeymoon. It is unclear if this was the fault of the booking agent Airfare.com or Air Antilles / Air Guyane / Winair. We had to fly out the next day, giving up a day on our honeymoon and our non refundable hotel reservation. 
On our return flight, we missed our connection due to an hour delay in which were never given an explanation and then received zero assistance on rebooking. We ended up having to book another flight back to the states. All in all, flying with this airline cost about $2000 and a lost day of our honeymoon. Never, ever fly with them.
Points négatifs : Au retour : "Panne" d'eau (Pas de toilettes, pas de cafés le matin, ...)

Points positifs : La bienveillance de tout le personnel ...Points négatifs : J'avais choisi AIR MAURITIUS (tout était validé "AIR MAURITIUS") et je me suis retrouvée sur ... AIR FRANCE ! ?

Pourquoi ?
Bien Points positifs : Le service

Terrible and Delayed. Missed my connection Points positifs : Crew were friendly and helpful. Points négatifs : Flight was delayed all throughout.
Plane was old and uncomfortable compared to other Air Mauritius planes I’ve used. 
Food really bad
I did Not enjoy this flight whatsoever 
Missed my onward connections

Could it get worse Points positifs : It landed safelyPoints négatifs : Delayed 3hrs with no information just apologies. Toilets onboard not clean and leaking. Several trays broken. Coffe/Tea served by pouring over customers rather than tray with cup. Safety information only shown when landing. Staff bumped isle passengers several times (me 4 times) with no apology. Chaos in serving dinner as special meals and vegetarian meals sent to wrong seats.

exctremely cramped Points positifs : I sat onseat 8c on this old Airbus 319 and my knees were killing me so little legroom. Im only 1.78m Points négatifs : Take out one row and give cattle class a little bit mor space please. I already have deep vein trombosis from flying.

Points négatifs : The quality of the entertainment hardware system is rather old and out dated as opposed to most other long haul airlines I’ve sat on which I really think Air Mauritius should consider upgrading. It’s the only airline that I don’t even bother using their entertainment system at all.

CatastrophiquePoints négatifs : L’incapacité d’Air Mauritius à gérer des crises. Nous avons été coincés à cause d’un cyclone pendant 5 jours et à aucun moment je n’ai eu d’infos pertinentes d’Air Mauritius. Je ne reproche pas à Air Mauritius de n’avoir pas décollé, mais plutôt son incapacité à gérer les attentes de clients. Et c’est à cela qu’on distingue un entreprise performante d’une entreprise mediocre. Je pense que la Direction d’Air Mauritius est incompétente et cela ruisselle sur tout le personnel. Je me pose des questions sur sa capacité à gérer une vraie crise où la sécurité des passagers est en jeu.

Mediocre!Points négatifs : L’avion était vieux et très mal insonorisé. Peu d’espace pour les jambes. Le système vidéo ne fonctionne pas. Le repas était mauvais. Les sièges sont inconfortables et partent en lambeaux. Le personnel passe son temps à s’excuser pour les dysfonctionnements de l’appareil. Je les plains de devoir travailler dans de telles conditions. En tant que passager, je ne me sens pas en sécurité à cause de la vétusté de l’appareil.

Old plain, entertainment system also super old. Food bad.Points positifs : Plenty leg room space.Points négatifs : Interesting to see that they use the older plains to routes to "not so developed" countries, where they seem to account China. On other routes, the airline seems to be using much better plains with better overall service. I will surely avoid use this airline on flights from / to China.
L'embarquement, l'accueil, le personnel à bordPoints positifs : Le personnel était irréprochable!Points négatifs : L'insonorisation de l'avion, obligée de monter le son à fond pour regarder un film.

Points positifs : Got a notification well in advance that it would be significantly delayed.Points négatifs : IT WAS 13 HOURS LATE!!! Made me miss an important dinner, lost opportunity to sleep before an important day of conference meetings, and missed a breakfast meeting as well. Valuable time was lost due to this absurd delay. Seats were small. Won't rely on Air Mauritius again.
Points négatifs : Mon bagage n'est pas arrivé!!!!

Points positifs : The Air Mauritius plane was actually quite comfortable.Points négatifs : The entertainment on the flight operated by Air Mauritius was not great. It was still old-fashioned and not interactive. 

The breakfast on Air Mauritius was not healthy at all and was extremely carby and sugary. It could do with some additional protein and less sugar. The vegetarian dinner could also have done with some additional protein.

Points négatifs : Seating is quite cramped, I am not a tall person but couoldn't get comfort with the space between seats. Anyway, the crew requested passengers to straigthen up their seat during meal-time which was a bit of relief. 

Breakfast was mediocre - one bread with hot drink after 6 hours inflight. Crew provided excellent service though through offering additional drinks.
Points positifs : Staff were very nice, meal was good. Points négatifs : Cramped seating, full plane.
Points positifs : Food was very good.Points négatifs : Seats were cramped.

Points positifs : Aircrew were great, friendly and professional. Meal was very good. Points négatifs : Seating was cramped and people in front kept their seats fully inclined during the full 7 hour flight.

The usual medium-distance, small-plane flightPoints positifs : CrewPoints négatifs : Seats (very uncomfortable)
Leg room (way too little)

Luggage deliberately left behind when continuing tPoints négatifs : We continued our journey from Mauritius to Reunion, and given the quite small plane, Air Mauritius deliberately left one of our suitcases (and a few others of other passengers) behind. This was then only brought to our hotel the next day at noon (36 h late). Very annoying, as they didn't tell us beforehand (then, at least we could have packed some essentials in our hand luggage).

TNR TripPoints positifs : Air Mauritius was a pleasent surprise. The aircraft was clean and the staff wasattentive. The biggest surprise was they served a meal
on the short midday flight and that meal was delicious.
Points positifs : Le personnel était très sympa, le repas était très bon.Points négatifs : Petit coin salon, un avion le lendemain.
Points positifs : La nourriture était très bonne.Points négatifs : Sièges étaient très étroites.

Points positifs : The only think I enjoyed is knowing I will never fly them againPoints négatifs : What went right? From the hidden fees to the made up regulations where they try to charge 10-50 euros for CARRY ON BAGGAGE to the inefficient way in which they move you through the system to the 2.5 hr delay causing us to miss our connection because of "PERSONAL REASONS" according to our pilot (even though the plane landed on time and just sat on the tarmac)

Points positifs : NOTHINGPoints négatifs : COnnected from an international flight coming from philly. Due to customs we made it to our plane 30
Minutes before departure (8:52 for a 9:30 departure we were at the gate looking at our plane). Half the reason we were delayed is because not only did we have to pick up our bags and clear customs but we then had to recheck them, not a problem except for the fact that NO BODY WAS AT THE TICKET COUNTER. So Frankfurt airport was gracious enough to let us back through customs with our checked bags (after collecting them in baggage claim). When we showed up they wouldn't let us on the plane and charged us 350 dollar rebooking fee to leave the next day at 3 pm. it only gets worse as no one helped us to rebook, we had to call a number then then had us write an email to the company. I am still beside my self on how terrible of an experience this was as we had to do all of this calling from the Frankfurt airport because no one would help us in person (using skype).

TerriblePoints négatifs : They would not let me board the plane because the flights to get to mink, Belarus had a change of plane in Moscow. They demanded that I have a Russian visa. I explained repeatedly that I am only transiting through Moscow and am not leaving the secured airport area. Still, they did not allow me to board the plane. I had to cancel the flight and buy a new ticket from a different airline that did not transit through Moscow. 

Kayak and Belavia must tell the passenger prior to ticket purchase that if the flight goes out trough Moscow a Russian visa is required. in my case, they never told me this until I arrived in the airport to board the plane. A terrible experience.

Points positifs : Nothing!
Late and no explanation or pardon!

Flight was Cancelled after Received Boarding Pass,Points positifs : Air Moldova staff did work out a series of other flights that got me to my needed destination after I called for a better solution than was offered.Points négatifs : I did not like that the flight was cancelled on short notice and the initial rebooking I was given was for 15 hours after my scheduled flight (which caused a domino affect that would cost me an additional $150). I did get a different booking when I called and requested it, but it turned a 9-hour travel day into a 24-hour travel; I only did not lose money because ItaliaRail was flexible with me and my hotel in my final destination allowed me a very late check-in.

I did not like that Air Moldova did not contact me - my online booking source notified me of the change, not Air Moldova.

They charge extra for luggage!!Points négatifs : I have purchased tickets ( 1 bag is included ). At the time of the check in they charged me $20 for the 1st bag ( each way) . The total price for the trip went $40 up. Payment was accepted in cash only , with no receipt given!

Hot & extra 190 Euros( $220)Points négatifs : We arrived for our flight 1 hour before the flight. They told us we were late then forced us to check one of our carryons because it weighed over 8 KG. (not too big just weighed too much) and was not a problem carrying on other flight. 10 Euros.
We arrived at the gate 30 minutes before take-off and they had not started boarding yet. We were then pulled out of the boarding line and told that we had to pay a late fee of 60 Euros each because we were late. 180 Euros! We had to go back to the cashier counter in the ticket terminal to pay and then again go through customs/passport and transit screening. We still made it back to the gate in time to board and leave by departure time. We then waited for passengers from another connecting flight to arrive and board so we then left about 30 minutes late. Then the air conditioning was broken to we fumed in 90 degree heat all the way to St. Petersburg.

Wasted time...Points négatifs : Flew from London to Moscow with a 40min layover in Chisinau. I had to get off the plane with all my belongings, go into the airport, through security and check back in only to board the exact same airplane to go to Moscow! The most complete waste of time and energy ever experienced! Complete rubbish as the Londoners would say. Almost missed the flight and it was delayed because of the 5-6 of us that were in the same predicament. Air Moldova, you guys need to change your ways.

Points positifs : CheapPoints négatifs : The seat did not recline.

Points négatifs : Seats don't recline, no entertainment on board.

Points positifs : never got to be on the plane since the flight was cancelled without notice nor explanation.Points négatifs : No service at all given. I had to organize myself alone!!! Waited 8 hours at he airport without any help. Nowhere to claim, no reimbursement...just nothing.Was transferred on another airline that did not explain anything. Very bad first and last experience

Flight Cancellation - Terrible ServicePoints positifs : I was placed in a very nice hotel for the night. Emirates staff very helpful in helping me get on another flight.Points négatifs : When I arrived at the airport the next morning on January 1st 2017 to get on another flight, the lady at the OR Tambo Air Namibia ticketing office (her name is Happy) gave me a very hard time. She told me that the staff from the night before should not have put me in a hotel, and that she could not give me another flight. Her reason was that I had booked the flight through a travel agency website and so it was not Air Namibia's responsibility to get me on another flight. When I tried to explain to her why it was she started to yell at me. "Don't tell me how to do my job", she said. As I started to explain again that I paid for the flight and that Air Namibia surely received compensation and would not be out any money by placing me on another flight she told me to "stop arguing" with her.

I took my claim to the Emirates counter, very upset from a fight I did not need to have and lack of sleep the past two days of traveling. The Emirates staff called Happy over to explain to her why she should get me on a flight. Happy finally agreed, but by this time the flight was about to leave and I almost missed it. Because of her delay, I had to run through the airport, and my bag did not make it on. When I finally received my luggage a week later, it was broken and torn with the contents spilling out.

If Happy had better customer service skills and had helped me instead of giving me a hard time, I would not have had the horrible day that I did and resultant destroyed luggage.

In my opinion, she should be fired, and I strongly advise Emirates not to connect flights with this airline (who apparently makes these types of cancellations every year). If a customer service representative from Air Namibia would like more details on this matter please contact me at callahcl@gmail.com

Points négatifs : They lost our luggage dispate the fact that this was only 50 minutes flight! Also, we left late, and the process to track down our luggage was terrible! We had to buy extra stuff and no one will reimburse us for this.

Points négatifs : The fact that I got bumped from the flight because the plane was already full then got stranded in Maun for a second night with no prospect of a flight on the 3rd day.

Points négatifs : My air was broken. The flight was nauseating. The flight attendants were extremely rude. There were drinks and food offered to some passengers but not others. The flight attendants did not speak in English and did not seem to care if anyone understood what they said in Spanish. The plane was old and creepy looking.

Small Plane, On Time, Nice FAPoints positifs : I took Air Namibia from Victoria Falls to Windhoek. It was a small plane (3 seats across total) which I don't like too much as you feel every like bit of turbulence. With the exception of take off and landing, it was fine. They served food and free drinks even though it was an hour and forty-five minute flight which surprised me. Overall, I was pleased. There were only 14 passengers and one flight attendant.
Pleasantly surprised.Points positifs : I liked the fact that they served drinks right away. It's nice to sit back and relax. The food was plentiful and good. I was pleasantly surprised.
Pleasantly surprised!Points positifs : Full meal service, even on 1.5hr flight. Smooth take off and landing. Excellent inflight service. Free checked bag.Points négatifs : Nothing. Flight was great.

Points négatifs : Auckland to Chicago was fine. Chicago to Minnesota was horrible. The departure plane showed up late due to weather which is understandable. Points négatifs : Terrible customer service.

Points positifs : SafetyPoints négatifs : The flight was not on time 
There was no food on the plane for us even though we paid “full service carrier” price
There were very few free movies!!! This is horrible. We wished we’d flown with Jetstar - lack of everything like with air New Zealand but at least the price would be much lower!
Points négatifs : Had to pay for most movies. They need to bring around water more often and actually offer it to window seats rather than handing a glass to the aisle and walking off.

Flight tracker kept breaking.Points négatifs : They don't come around with beverages hardly ever (twice on 13 hour flight) and they tend to skip the window seats. They tried to kick me off an overbooked flight even though I paid extra for a picked seat and booked months ago. Mediocre food. Tiny seats and I'm only 5'5". Will never fly again.

Points positifs : Comfortable seat.Points négatifs : Ran out of meal options, flight was delayed so one option breakfast not appropriate at midday. The flight attendant blamed the person in front of me for taking the last other option. I had to clarify with her that meant there was only one option left. She seemed annoyed at me for asking.
Points négatifs : They have to provide better food.

Points positifs : The sky couch is always very nice.Points négatifs : We told the crew the water tasted funny, like dirt, they said it was fine, just had lemon in it. Pretty sure we know the difference between lemon and dirt taste.

Points négatifs : After scanning boarding passes at gate, flight crew required us to show them again at the plane door. We had already stowed our phones, as I think others had. Minor issue but caused what seemed like an unnecessary backup at the cabin door. Our other domestic Air New Zealand flight didn't require it.
Points négatifs : No enough blankets when feeling cold

Points positifs : Crew was really nice however slightly absent during the flight.Points négatifs : Drinks should have been more frequently offered . Refreshments/water seemed hard to come by I had to chase them down in the galley only to get luke warm water...? Seats are pretty cramped and small with not much room.
Points positifs : Crew was very nice Points négatifs : Foot rest and seat recline was broken. Food was also just okay.

A good airline with a confused IdentityPoints positifs : AirBerlin has always been a lovely little airline. Wonderful crew and pilots all around. A bit more expensive than the low cost carriers, but better flight times and a normal flight experience (or what used to be normal) was their forte. Points négatifs : What I don't like. They don't know what they want to be. Not the crew or pilots, the executives.
In September AirBerlin changed their policy of serving 'free' food on flights. I understand that they are competing with the Low Cost carriers (especially as O'Leary has set his sights squarely on AirBerlin), but charging flights that cost more than double of a low cost, yet offering the same experience of a low cost is a sure way to lose customers. 
Case and point: Flight to Vienna, we were offered complimentary sandwiches and drinks. Return flight, they charged for drinks and food. 
Which is it, AirBerlin? Either do complimentary food and drinks and keep your customers or keep you fares the same, charge for drinks and food and lose customers. 
But doing both with no rhyme or reason shows that those in charge do not understand their business.

I would definitely fly AirBerlin again!Points positifs : The amount of care from the crew was enough to give 5 stars, but there was also good choices of movies to watch, and no troubles while boarding. Points négatifs : The seats can be a little small for someone who is 6'4, but that is my burden to bear. It was a little hard to check in online prior to getting to the airport.

Avoid Jetairfly and TUIPoints positifs : Nothing possitve to say here.Points négatifs : I've flown hundreds of flights, and this was my first time with Justairfly (TUI), and it will be my last. In Brussels there was a mechanical failure and the flight was delayed. The problem was that it was delayed 14+ hours. Now sometimes things happen, I understand that, but how you handle those situations is something else. Jetsirfly handled this very very poorly, with complete disregard to its passengers. They would require us to return to the gate almost every 2 hours for the next 14 hours. Then when 200+ people return to the gate Jetairfy and their representatives would not be there. 

They violated many EU statutes regarding passengers rights. And when this was brought to their attention, they would become hostile, and violate more! For instance, by law, when the delay is five hours or longer, passengers may opt for reimbursement of the full cost of the ticket together with, when relevant, a return flight to the first point of departure. I specifically requested reimbursement and to be returned to my point of origin, and was flat out denied for Jetairfly!

By law, if a flight is delayed by four hours or more and the final destination is over 1500 kilometers, the passengers are required to compensation. Not only did they not compensate us, they failed to notify us, as required by law, of this compensation. 

In general, they did an extremely poor job of handling the situation and myself, and 100+ other passengers have reported them to the authorities.

I'll never fly or use Jetairfly or TUI again. And I suggest you avoid this. Airline at all costs.

Points positifs : Service with a smile. As our flight was redirected to Ostend, the signage was clearly marked to get to the transfer bus to Brussels and the water that was given to passengers before boarding the bus was a nice and welcome touch.Points négatifs : It was not clear in Dalaman Airport why they were shouting "Izmir" as if they were looking for passengers to Izmir, and it appeared as though boarding was to a flight to Izmir, yet we were all travelling to Ostend. Strange! I thought I was at the wrong gate as I couldn't see a sign indicating Ostend at the boarding area. When I asked if the plane went to Ostend they said yes and took my ticket--but this was never announced.

promising new airline in the marketPoints positifs : The food quality and the inflight entertainment were better than most other commercial airlines. The free upgrade to premium economy due to availability was also welcome. Points négatifs : Three things :

1) The crew seemed to be relatively inexperienced and just out of college. I observed a couple of informal communication exchanges from their part. But the crew were helpful and tried their best to provide the best customer experience.
2) The boarding process normally starts with business and premium class and then followed by economy. For my flight however the economy class was boarded first while the business class passengers were kept stranded waiting in a separate line. This also reflected the inexperience of the crew which handled the boarding.
3) Vistara was my connecting flight from Pune to Delhi followed by British airways flight from Delhi to London. Though the flights were booked under one ticket, the representative did not checkin my luggage throughout the journey due to which I had to collect my baggage at Delhi and check it in again. The representative explained that vistara still didn't have alliances with most airlines allowing luggage to be checked in till final destination. This is another front on which they can improve.

Points négatifs : No food, plane felt pretty old and not so clean. Smaller seats than the other flights I had with Lufthansa. Otherwise, it was fine. I had a pretty bad earache on that particular flight, so I liked it less than I might have otherwise. Something didn't feel right, pressure wrong or something.

Same airline, but it felt a bit more upscalePoints positifs : It was better with the earache, plane felt cleaner, the crew was more friendly and attentive. Didn't feel as dark as the first flight. Points négatifs : The Star Alliance flights aren't that cheap. Comparable price between Lufthansa, Swiss, SAS and Austrian. Lufthansa gives you food, and has friendly service. SAS gives you coffee and tea. On Austrian and Swiss I didn't get anything. For same price range and same alliance, that is a point I keep in mind. Now I mainly try to get onto Lufthansa flights (or Turkish Airlines which is my favorite). Even on Aegean, I got better food, and the magazine was better, plus there were some monitors to track the flight. Austrian feels cheaper than the others. That is the main point I didn't like.

Flight canceled , no communication Points négatifs : My flight was canceled and I received no communication from Austrian Airlines. There was no staff at ticketing counter. The contact number that O’Hare had was a disconnected Verizon number, which was the same number listed on their website. I had to call the international number where I was told I was rebooked on United with 2 layovers instead of one. I also lost my business class upgrade and was told there was nothing they could do about it.

Austrian Airlines has a service of a budget carrier Points positifs : Clean and new planes. On time. Points négatifs : On the transatlantic flight the crew was unattractive and somewhat rude. They skipped our entire row serving morning refreshments and then complained and tried to shame us all for calling them back. Food quality was on par with Alegent Airlines. We even got charged for one piece of checked luggage 46lb on a international flight. That was a first!!!

Predatory and unprofessional staff and business modelPoints positifs : Not much. The pilot was communicative.Points négatifs : The staff were pushy and rude to me when they told me at the gate, when I was about to board, that I could not have a backpack and small purse. This is not what I understood when booking and is not clearly explained at the time of purchase. One attendant at the gate in particular was forceful and rude when insisting that I pay over $66 in cash at a moment when going to the ATM would mean potentially missing boarding and not arriving back in time to the gate. This process, which I agreed to because two staff members gave me the impression that I could not travel on the flight unless I paid right there instantly in CASH (completely ridiculous), caused me anxiety and took a long time, too long given the urgency of boarding the flight. I had to wait for change for 5 minutes and as a result, I was the last one to board. 

It should be noted that this process of paying for a maleta in hand at the gate had been preceded by having to pay over $20 in cash to print a boarding pass, which required another ATM withdrawal and fee. This is a weak and predatory business model, which seeks to exploit people’s need to travel and their anxiety. This was carried out in a completely unprofessional and manipulative manner by the staff members. This kind of behavior is unacceptable and exploitative.

Terrible plane, terrible seat, terrible flight with terrible delayPoints positifs : - The crew upon the flight who were customer-facing were adequate.
- Thomas Cook Airlines tried to make amends for putting their customers on a back-up plane with no in-flight entertainment with a 10 dollar gift certificate. It was better than nothing, so that's appreciated.Points négatifs : - The flight was delayed heavily, both coming in to land at the airport to pick the passengers up, but also leaving Miami.

- The plane was a backup aircraft-- not an Air Tanker plane, which was originally supposed to fly the route, but a Hi-Fly plane; and from the looks and feel of it, and the "no cellphone" stickers which looked like they came from the early 80's when cellphones were still giant bricks-- I'm not an airline technician, but this plane looked really rough. 

- I would not have bought a ticket on the airline if I knew I'd be flying almost 9 hours (which ended up being 12+ hours, since we sat on the runway for 3 hours) in this extremely shoddy, uncomfortable aircraft. 
The seats were tiny, with old smelly upholstry, and the panels which lined in the inside of the craft were coming apart. 
No electronics worked, there were lights missing, and the screens on the back of the seat in front of me was popping out of the seat. 

- The seat I received was the last row against the wall-- and it did NOT recline. I'm 6'3''. And the person in front of me decided they'd like to recline all the way back, so I spent most of the flight feeling like a sardine, with a broken screen popping out of the seat in my face.
I would NEVER fly overseas on this airline again. 

- In flight food was really poor, and there was no in-flight entertainment.

Mal servicioPoints positifs : El abordaje. Muy rápido y a tiempoPoints négatifs : La venta de boletos dicen que deben ser 10kgs de peso por maleta documentada, sin embargo si viajas con familia los kilos no se consideran como de todos, si no por pasajero, nosotros somos una familia de 4 tendríamos un peso de 40kgs gratuitos, entonces tenemos una maleta de 28 kilos y una de 7 kilos, sin embargo nos cobraron por la maleta de 28 kilos por excedente de peso, pues es por pasajero, además nos cobraron por cada kilo excedente aún y cuando en una revista de la propia compañía decía que deberían cobrar como un todo el excedente, y cuando les mostramos la revista porque nos cobraban en exceso, nos indicaron que solo era aplicable si es ELECTRÓNICO, vaya timo y molestia, que si no queríamos pasar que ellos venden unas bolsas para sacar de la maleta grande y dividirla en 3 bolsas, WOOOOWWW que estupidez, luego con mi backpack, normal nada en exceso de tamaño me pedían pagar para poderla pasar en el avión, pues esa no cuenta como bolsa de mano, por lo que tuve que comprar una bolsa de Dama , para poner mi computadora y cargadores en la misma, para pode subirlas al avión, es decir chicos, varones hombres, si viajan en esta compañía favor de llevar una bolsa de dama, porque si llevan su backpack aunque sea de tamaño pequeño, tendrán que pagar exceso de equipaje.
Muy mala experiencia. Al adquirir los boletos en el propio mostrador nos indicaron que teníamos que dividir la maleta posteriormente revise la página electrónica y tampoco decía esto, he viajado de forma constante como mi familia, y es la primera compañía que no suma los kilos, lo cual en mi parecer es completamente ilógico, como pedirle a un niños de 5 años que lleve su maleta de 10 kilos?????.
Espero esto les sea de ayuda. Esta compañía es una subsidiaria de aerofoto me indicaron, y que él mismo aeroflot aplica los mismos en todos sus vuelos, así que tengan cuidado o infórmense mejor.

It took them 2 hours to tell me if they would book me on another airline to try to make my connection, and by then it was too late. They tried to not give me a hotel room because it was a "technical" delay, and only after I showed them the email I received that it was a "schedule change" did they give me a hotel. They also didnt offer food vouchers for the 3+ hr delay until the airport restaurant asked FOR us. I was so frustrated by the lack of caring that I bought my own one way ticket home on another airline.

Truly the worst experience of my lifePoints positifs : There is nothing I liked about this flight Points négatifs : At the jfk airport business class check in desk with my mother in law, with 3 bags to check in. The first two bags went in fine. But the lady from royal air moroc was putting tags on our bags and started checking in another passenger X at the same time. I said wait a minute, let’s do one passanger at a time. Lady insisted she knew what she was doing. Of course she put my name tag to passanger X bag and my bag was assigned to passangers X name and destination. I didn’t realized that until after I landed in Malaga, our destination, the next morning. We were in Malaga for 5 nights and didn’t receive our bag until 8 hours before our flight back to nyc. The first two bags didn’t arrive with us either. they arrived the next night after we landed in Malaga. No clothes no toiletries for 2 days. 
We requested seafood meal in business class and was given the most disgusting meal I’ve ever seen. Cold seafood mash with cold veggies. It smelled so bad. I couldn’t even take a bite.

Terrible Points négatifs : The airline canceled our flight. We were not informed of the cancellation until it was too late. We had to take a bus to our connecting flight in Casablanca which led to missing our flight to Lisbon. We lost an entire day. Never flying with this airline again
Points négatifs : Flight was delayed more than 8 hours and I reason were given

Awful experiencePoints positifs : Nothing at allPoints négatifs : We had an infant and at gate check, the baggage handler slammed our stroller to the ground. Formula, bottles, etc, should be allowed. FInally the kicker, we didnt receive our checked luggage upon arrival to CMN. We had to run through the streets of CMN after midnight searching for a store open for diapers, formula, clothes, etc. The staff of Air Maroc were awful. They could not provide a reason for the lost luggage nor a time when it will get here. 26 hours later, and after spending our own money to get to and fro the airport, we received our luggage. Never again Air Maroc, never again!

Lost Baggage and very poor service Points positifs : We arrived safely, so I’m thankful for that...Points négatifs : Air Maroc lost my luggage and has been unable to come up with any information about its whereabouts. The airline largely runs its lost luggage operations on pads of paper as far as I can tell. They’re agents at Casablanca airport were bordering on belligerent rather than helpful. It is nearly impossible to get a straight answer from anyone. Glad we arrived safely but that’s about all I can say for this airline. Do NOT check your bags, make sure they come under the arbitrary carry on weight limit that Air Maroc uses.

This I expected as I traveled through there before. Where the frustration stared was when the original departure time was delayed but no one said anything until the actual departure time. Then they would update everyone hourly. It wasn't until the enemies plane started causing a scene and becoming loud and irritated that they finally gave us the real time (+3 hours) after our scheduled time. Once we got on the plane, it took another 45 minutes for the pilot to show up.

Nothing major herePoints positifs : Newer plane. Staff were nice enough. No major complaints.Points négatifs : We departed late. Boarding was fairly unorganized and most of us were stressed out about making our connecting flight to New York. Also, I've never before been forced to put my laptop into my checked luggage. I really have no idea what that's about. They also wrap it completely in plastic, I guess, to prove that no one has tampered with it. Still, I felt for this one couple on my flight whose luggage had been lost on the flight to Marrakech, and now they're being told they have to put an essential such as a laptop into luggage that very well might be lost again? Ridiculous. (Turned out okay, though, but the bottom line is there should be some choice in the matter.)

Avoid Checking Bags On This Flight!Points positifs : Made to Casablanca alive.Points négatifs : My bag and the bags of two other people on my flight were lost, although there were only 10 total people on the flight.

ChaoticPoints positifs : Food better than expected.Points négatifs : Still no explanation for very long delay. No effort to control baggage brought on board and where it was placed.

Lost Important LuggagePoints négatifs : Our luggage did not arrive to JFK. We landed on Saturday, 1/27, and there is still no update.... It had expensive rugs and gifts and spices plus more.

Truly the worst experience of my lifePoints positifs : There is nothing I liked about this flight Points négatifs : At the jfk airport business class check in desk with my mother in law, with 3 bags to check in. The first two bags went in fine. But the lady from royal air moroc was putting tags on our bags and started checking in another passenger X at the same time. I said wait a minute, let’s do one passanger at a time. Lady insisted she knew what she was doing. Of course she put my name tag to passanger X bag and my bag was assigned to passangers X name and destination. I didn’t realized that until after I landed in Malaga, our destination, the next morning. We were in Malaga for 5 nights and didn’t receive our bag until 8 hours before our flight back to nyc. The first two bags didn’t arrive with us either. they arrived the next night after we landed in Malaga. No clothes no toiletries for 2 days. 
We requested seafood meal in business class and was given the most disgusting meal I’ve ever seen. Cold seafood mash with cold veggies. It smelled so bad. I couldn’t even take a bite.

Terrible Points négatifs : The airline canceled our flight. We were not informed of the cancellation until it was too late. We had to take a bus to our connecting flight in Casablanca which led to missing our flight to Lisbon. We lost an entire day. Never flying with this airline again

Awful experiencePoints positifs : Nothing at allPoints négatifs : We had an infant and at gate check, the baggage handler slammed our stroller to the ground. Moreover, the rudeness of the flight attendant was something I've never seen. She claimed our carry on was too heavy to be brought on board. We had a baby for gods sake. Formula, bottles, etc, should be allowed. FInally the kicker, we didnt receive our checked luggage upon arrival to CMN. We had to run through the streets of CMN after midnight searching for a store open for diapers, formula, clothes, etc. The staff of Air Maroc were awful. They could not provide a reason for the lost luggage nor a time when it will get here. 26 hours later, and after spending our own money to get to and fro the airport, we received our luggage. Never again Air Maroc, never again!

Flight We booked was cancelled. Points positifs : Nothing to like. We had a connecting flight. We missed the international connection. Points négatifs : Flight was canceled. We were not notified until we checked in at the airport. Was booked on a later flight. Missed our international connection. Loss our luggage. Had to buy ($2000+) 2 international air tickets one way to get home by Sunday night. One week now still no luggage. Unreliable. Never again.

Lost Baggage and very poor service Points positifs : We arrived safely, so I’m thankful for that...Points négatifs : Air Maroc lost my luggage and has been unable to come up with any information about its whereabouts. The airline largely runs its lost luggage operations on pads of paper as far as I can tell. They’re agents at Casablanca airport were bordering on belligerent rather than helpful. It is nearly impossible to get a straight answer from anyone. Glad we arrived safely but that’s about all I can say for this airline. Do NOT check your bags, make sure they come under the arbitrary carry on weight limit that Air Maroc uses.

The seat layout of the usual Adria Airbus A319 operated Bucharest-Munich-Bucharest S5-AAX differs from your plan! You need two different versions of Adria A319 seat plans. Row 10 is the Exit Row on S5-AAX. 10A is a superb seat, comfy with plenty of leg room. There is a nice little holder for a drink in addition to the tray table .. handy especially in turbulence. The aircraft’s appearance internally is excellent, clearly refurbished and well maintained.

I have flied many times with this aircraft. Adria has 3 a319, two newer ones (S5-AAP, S5-AAR) with over head LCD screens and one older one (S5-AAX). I more like older one, because it have newer seats and more legroom. In the review (stars) i will be rewiewing newer ones.
The seat was okay (although interior was quite outdated compared to new easyjet or ba planes) but the leg room was little - similar to A319 austrian operated by air berlin

An effortless check in and transfer to the aircraft, followed by an on-time departure. Friendly, helpful service with a smile followed, then they pretty much left us alone.  Aircraft was clean and comfortable, tidy up was quick and unrushed.  A nice soft landing and very brisk disembarkation completed the trip.

Excellent seat with plenty of legroom, dedicated overhead locker for rows 1
Plane great . Flight crew great .

This isn't the first time using Dublin, Aer Lingus and the US Pre-clearance, but it was the first I used the automated entry machines, easy to use but for some reason the CBP guy did the whole finger print thing again when I handed the recipe from the machine to him, the CBP seem to be doing this with everyone.... it seems a waste of time  having the machines. As for the flight the experience was ok, my only criticism was the seat, I found it very uncomfortable after a few hours, the base had no cushion worth speaking of on it, all the seats are the same in economy, it is like sitting on a park bench,  I had a muscle on the back of my left leg hurting for a day or two after the flight.  The food was ok, as was the service from the crew, I wasn't impressed with the  entertainment but that is probably just me.  If the seat base had been better the whole flight would have been close to 100% (if  flying economy can ever be described that way) 
As I only have hand luggage the plus side to flying from Dublin and the using the pre-clearance is that 5 minutes from leaving the plane you can be out of the terminal  and on your way.

Check in was satisfactory compared to previous journeys I've taken with "world class" airlines such as Delta; Singapore; Emeriates; Ethiad; Turkish and British Airways. The cabin was dull and there was nothing of interest. I was very disappointed. I was expecting more for the cost of the ticket. Aer Lingus seriously needs to re-think it's cabin interior. I was disgusted when I entered the lavatory. It was of economy standards and looked ghastly compared to the first class lavatory on Emeriates. At this stage of the flight, the food was as I expected; inadequate and unacceptable. I was promised "luxury dining", but I received the contrary. The seat was cramped making an uncomfortable overall flying experience. Thankfully, the flight stewards were very professional greeting me with a smile the moment I stepped on the plane. They were extremely helpful throughout the entire flight and the service was great. The uniform may need to be updated though. If only we could transfer the stewards to a better company. I will not be travelling with Aer Lingus in the near future and I will not recommend Aer Lingus to any of my colleagues. Issues  with the cabin and food need to be dealt with right away and until these changes take place the first class flying community will be utterly disappointed with their time with Aer Lingus.

I opted for an exit seat, which Aer Lingus provide at a small extra cost. I am fairly tall, so this was a good opportunity to make sure I got this extra legroom. The journey was as pleasant as possible on an airplane.Being at an exit, the table is folded into armrest, so the seat is a bit norrower than the standard seat.

Average seat, had a low sodium meal, good quality. Service was very good with the  flight stewards being kind and attentive. Had enough place for my feet and sat comfortably. Even fell asleep on the upright positioned chair. Only minus was as soon as the person in front of me reclined her seat it was hard to get out of my seat.

The seats were so narrow and as soon as the person in front reclined I was barely able to get out of my seat. Tray too close so couldn't open it properly. Food on the way was good on the way home not so good. Service was very good attentive and polite. Biggest complaint was the small seat for  a 6 hour flight.

Had a pleasant flight on an aisle seat. Enough legroom for a tall person like myself, evening meal service and bkfst was very adequate.  Flight staff was very courteous and helpful.  My only concern was the noise level of those giant engines.

I was very comfortable..and as a person who needs assistance..it was perfect. The crew were very helpful and the service was excellant. The steward even stayed with us on the plane as we waited for my scooter.
This seat was the most uncomfortable airliner seat I have ever sat in. I would never, never take a long flight in this aircraft with this airline ever again. It was poor torture.

This was my first time on EI-DAA, and while it was okay, it wasn't brilliant.  When I boarded the plane, I headed for my seat - 40K.

I was one of the first down the back as I knew the amount of available overhead storage would be abysmal.  How abysmal became apparent as there were bins full of cardboard bassinets for people traveling with kids, to locked bins with items for the crew and little space for the paying customers.  I managed to get an overhead bin 2 seats up from me that was compartmentalized with 2 spaces - a space sized for one bag and the 2nd space had room for 3 other bags.  I managed to get the smaller compartment but others were less successful finding space when they managed to board. 
With regards to my seat, I had no-one beside me at takeoff.....but that changed not long into the flight.  A lady sitting in another seat experienced a failure with her headphone jack and decided to test other headphone jacks at empty seats and as the jack at the seat beside me worked, I inherited a seatmate who ended up encroaching on my space.

The seat space was tight, given the fuselage does narrow given the proximity to the tail but I had reasonably good leg room and it was a comfy Recaro seats.  Once airborne it wasn't too bad but the controller for the AVOD was battered to hell but still functioned.

The location and state of the restrooms left a lot to be desired.  From trying to get to any of them when the crew are working, to one restroom running out of paper towels and other passengers flushing items that should have been binned, they were kinda gross by the end of the flight.

Food was okay with the chance to buy snacks but soft drinks were free (I think - I was drinking water) and of course booze was available for purchase.

On the whole, the plane felt old and unloved and the rear galley was sad and in a sorry state.  While the crew were okay, it wasn't the best flight I ever had.  R.I.P to the Aer Lingus I once knew.

Pros:
Good AVOD choices, reasonably comfortable seating, 2 windows (for those people who like to look out and take snaps)

Cons:
Tight seating (shoulder to shoulder), if the person in front of you reclines their seat you are screwed, poor restroom sizes and locations, poor available space in the overhead bins and sad interior decoration.

Extremely helpful, kind, caring, efficient staff (especially Keiran) as I had a bad pain experience during the flight.  They helped but weren’t overbearing, but kept an eye on me personally despite all their responsibilities.

This is in. 2 seat only row so ideal for couples. Toilets are not at back of plane do not lots of people walking past. Aisle seat has slightly less room to store bag under seat in front than window seat. Movie choice was poor.
Staff was very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend Aer Lingus Airline and will fly with you again. Wonderful service!!
Nice aircraft. Very noisy at this seat location.
Best flight ever!

Space saver seats meant that the legroom was very good. However, I wouldn't want to take a flight longer than an hour or so as the padding was minimal. The width of the seat was OK; comparable to a Boeing 737. Better to pick the rearmost seats as the entry/exit is at the rear of the plane. Cabin baggage space was a little tighter than usual and they can enforce a smaller bag limit on the regional flights if the plane is full.

Comfortable business class seat for a couple.  Easy access table, long length at fully reclined.  No wifi.  Attendants very helpful.  Food great, including appetizer, main, and dessert. Single seats are Captain Kirk style.
Very pleasant flight!

24B is actually the Exit row seat (shown on the plan as row 23) Great amount of legroom allowing you to stretch out during the flight. The seat was a little narrow but didn't cause a problem for myself...a larger size traveler may be uncomfortable.
Very close to the toilets on board (3 of) so people do congregate around the area. (Didn't cause too much of a problem but can be busy at certain times)
The plane is small for a transatlantic flight and this flight was extremely full with only 1 or 2 seats spare.
Food was OK quality (and served quickly) Took a long time to be cleared away though.
As this was an exit row you cannot store any belongings at all on the floor or watch the entertainment system during take off or landing. (This didn't bother me but some flyers like to watch the screens for the full flight)

I think this plane is a bit small for transatlantic travel, but it was actually better than I expected. I am not fond of sitting in seats where you can't stow any luggage in front of you, as were these exit row seats, because it's not convenient to retrieve things during travel, and because the seats are slightly narrower due to having the tray tables in the armrest. I would probably try the "more room" seats in row 4 next time. We paid extra for the "upgrade" meal and it was a very generous amount of food (too much, actually!), and very tasty. Would probably do it again for dinner, but I think it's too much food for lunch. Staff was friendly and attentive.

Are Lingus claims a 31” seat pitch for these seats and there is no way that is accurate, it appears to be 29”. Seats are very narrow and extremely uncomfortable. Plane was old and worn out, seats and tray tables broken. Live map did not work on both to/from flights which is annoying because you don’t know when this most horribly uncomfortable flight will ever end! Never again will I fly a 757 overseas if I can avoid it. And Aer Lingus’ planes have fallen into disarray. Legroom pitiful, and comfort atrocious!

Aer Lingus shows the row as emergency row aft of the restrooms. Close, but instead it's a non-reclining row just forward of the lavatories.
Comfortable if you're small or have a small neighbor. A pain if the seat in front reclines but s gentle request usually helps.
We had the Asian vegetarian special meal and it was very good. 
Overall, not a bad flight - if sleepless. On the positive side we should have the exit row on our return

"A great seat!" A decent amount of legroom compared to other seats, it was enjoyable not having anyone in front of me. I loved having a movable monitor and a size adjustable tray. (Both come from your arm rest). I highly recommend choosing this seat. One problem, all of the seats on this aircraft don't recline a great amount.

Seats were so tight it was uncomfortable for a transatlantic flight. Whenever the person in front reclined I could hardly get out of my seat. Food good service was very good. Biggest problem was seating being too small and too close.
Big plane but me aerway so good

Avoid the lounges in the old part, one of the worst while the one in D is OK. Bording announcement much too early, caused 15 min waiting at the gate. Staff friendly, seats are short houl versions and if the seat in front is reclined not much space to step out. Food was good and service very attentative (much better than years ago!). You get a small tablet to watch movies. Flight arrived 15 min ahead scheduled time. Priority luggage came mixed with general luggage. All in all a good option as seats and service are better than Lufthansa.

A bit delayed but all around was good flt
no entertainment so bring your own you had a choice of pancakes oats or omelet (omelet was pretty good fyi im a very picky eater just saying)  but after a few mins into the omelet my fruit tray that I ordered arrived.   Lol guess if you have a special order you have to wait.. oh well!!  They both were good. seat to me was good for the 3+ hour flt.
down fall that I had was my carry on bag that needed to checked didnt not arrive with me and I had to wait three days to get it back tightly super wrapped in plastic.  When talking to the lost luggage CSA she promised they would deliver it to me that same day.  WRONG three days later I had to go pick it up at some express mail serive place in the middle of no where.  Good thing I had a car. 
Have photos but cant upload with my tablet maybe later
Good service.Seats were comfortable.No entertainment.Poor food.If you are not hungry I recommend this airline.
A spectacular service

Flt was pretty good. When boarding there was two CSAs standing by asking passengers if they wouldnt mind checking your carry on luggage cause of overhead bins being full.  I agreed HUGE MISTAKE!!!  My luggage was misplaced for three days.  When you walk on board you are greeted with a smile and a Russian hello! And asked to see your boarding ticket even if you know whère your going your still directed down either isle.  Youll find in coach a pillow and washed and warpped blanket in each seat.  The in flt entertainment doesnt start until push back from the gate. However the touch screen in front of me was a bit hard to use while seaching from movies and other things which made it annoying.  After take off youll receive an eye mask and slippers to use but, I found it odd the the company still used the two pronged headphone jack.   Haha but they supply you with the hard plastic ones what start to hurt after awhile.  The dinner and breakfast service was pretty good I had the fruit trays but the rest smelled good also.  The restroom wasnt so clean and was a bit smelly.   But again it was a pretty smooth 9+ hour flt with a few bumps here and there.  However I didnt recline my seat out of respect to the older heavy set guy sitting behind me but im sure my seat reclined nicely. 
Tablet wont let me upload the photos maybe I can when im back home and on the computer?  Cheers

Leg room is too little, and water service could be increased 3 more times. No water bottle was offered, nor cups available for self-service in the break areas. No delay take off, and the arrival time is kept very well. Flight attendants seem to work very hard, and were very polite. Much better than what I thought originally.

This is a great section of the Plane - cost only 100Euro to upgrade.  Foot rests and leg rests, and only 2 seats on the either side.    Still a little cumbersome if over 6' Service was great and flight was without any negative issue.  Would fly Aeroflot any time.

I flew on the A330-200 from JFK to Buenos Aires in Club Condor- Business Class.   Seat row numbers start at row 5 in Club Condor not at row 1 as displayed on SeatMaestro's map.   I sat on 7h.  The seat was a little hard and uncomfortable.  It was an inclined flat seat but i found if i placed it into a cradle mode it was more comfortable for sleeping.  The entertainment system was good.  There were a lot of programs and movies to chose from.  The meal needs improvement.  From the presentation to the taste and quantity.  The wines offered were bitter tasting and the orange juice was watery.  At JFK Aerolineas uses the British Airways Galleries lounge which was fine.  I have read bad comments about the airline on other sites, but i cant say my experience was unpleasant.  The crew were friendly from check-in to the onboard flight crew. The flight left on time and arrived on time.  I think they have made much improvements and i think they are headed in the right direction under the new CEO Mariano Reclade.  I would fly with them again.

First row of three seats behind row of four.  Screens are located in the back of the seats in front of you and are therefore slightly off center and not right in front of you. Armrest between D & F cannot be raised.  So it's not a good choice of seats if you want to score a whole row to yourself to sleep the flight off.  Folding tray tables are located inside armrest (not in the back of the seat in front of you).  They hardly recline, though I think that's the same with all other seats on this plane.

I travel with some frequency to and from this destination, always in business and especially, in the last flights, I have noticed improvements both in the quality of the drink and food as well as in service details, such as: delivery from the menu. I always highlight the quality of the attention of the staff, both the counter and the cabin! Very professional everyone! They should only improve the quality of the seats in the bed position, the passenger is somewhat inclined.

We travel in a row of four. It is not very comfortable for people with advanced AGE like us. The attention on board very good as well as when packing luggage. The good food in what is a passage in economy. I have no complaints. I always try to travel with the flag line of my country.

It is not the best row since it is the first of three seats after those of 4 seats. The food tray is smaller than normal and is inside the armrests. The food well in quantity but poor quality. Good entertainment, with varied alternatives

Excellent entertainment system. The crew is excellent and very friendly, all really, from the counter employees to the crew. The food is very good 8/10. The seats are good and I was able to sleep well. The breakfast is EXQUISITE

Good seat, better than I expected. The only thing to suggest is that they improve the seat base, it is very hard, not recommended for such long trips.
Entertainment system with varied programming.
Good attention on board.
Food 5 points (out of 10)

WE TRAVELED ON APRIL 16, LEAVING MADRID AT 20:10 HS.
VERY COMFORTABLE WITH AA, COMFORT OF THE LOCATION, SERVICE, MEALS, ALL EXCELLENT.
THE A340, LV -FPV, FULLY UPDATED IN THE YEAR 2015 IS REALLY FANTASTIC INSIDE
I have traveled both back and forth very badly, unable to move an inch, my knees touched the kidneys of the front passenger. I had not flown for 6 years and found worse comfort
Normal, clean, in good conditions. Enough space overhead for bags. Standard comfort for Eco class. I am a 1.75 mt tall person. Negative point is that it reclines a very, very few degrees.

Night time flight. Food and drinks were perfectly good. The cabin staff were helpful and courteous. We departed and arrived on time. The seats were tired looking but worked properly and while not a flat bed I slept soundly for many hours. Did not use entertainment -  I never do preferring to read or work. After reading other reviews I was worried but no need - would fly with AA again. and the fare was excellent value for business class.
This seat map does not match with the real plane. Flight was good and on time. Seats have acceptable recline angle (more than AA 777).

Of course, good, because it was placed in Emergency exit. But I have noticed that most of B's and G's in Tourist area have the Video entertainment devices where your feet should be, taking a lot of space.
Regarding food and beverage,  better take a sandwich with you from home.

It was horrible. The noise throughout the trip is unbearable, it is also very difficult to go out into the hall. The passenger screen next door was broken, I kept asking how it worked for me and the hostesses.
The Seat Electronic in Thema first 4 rows of this compartment does not work. More than 12 hours flighttime without entertainment, readinglamps and the possibility to call a flightattendent.
Beautiful plane, comfortable, spacious, serene and especially fast, final run at 1033 km / h, arrival 40 minutes ahead of schedule. The service of the crew, according to a company Skyteam, EXCELLENT.
Club Condor, a business class seat. Hard as an ironing  table, very worn, and very angry crew.
The seat is fine. But very small legroon
x
A clean, standard plane.

El problema de todos los ansientos de ventanilla es esa molesta caja metálica que impide estirar las piernas.  No se qué función cumple esa caja allí. Además tiene  una alta temperatura, lo que hace menos confortable el viaje. El menu sin gluten no es bueno. Y tampoco hay colaciones libres de gluten.

Our leg room was great, the seats are very small not to good on cushens. Right next to the bathrooms alot of people hanging around you not to quiet. Would do another airline I feel sorry for the other people in regular seats. I would never fly in them seats. I had exit seats.

It was very hard to find a comfortable position with alitalias classica seat. With the flight being 12 hours the seat was very uncomfortable and the entertainment system was out of date but still worked which was ok. The recline seemed generous having flown so many domestic flights.

If rows 1-4 are available, as was the case for me, book a seat here as lots of legroom. No extra cost. Seems their availability varies and no logic to it- coming back, seats in front of row 9 all booked; but they were in fact empty pretty much, in reality. Row 11 are exit seats, for £20 extra.Was a comfortable flight, and LCY is a great airport.

In one word - CRAMPED.  No hip room & No leg room.
No coffee?????  Why not?
People in row 3 had to put carry-ons as far back as rows 7 or 8; causing a lot of traffic in the aisle.
What a great improvement over the old MD80.Lots of room. Great flight

This was a great airplane with hardly any turbulence and the noise level wasn't bad. The seats weren't comfortable but the service was ok. The Airline finds lots of ways to get money out of you. I'm not flying this airline anytime soon.

I'm back, I have complete my trip sitting in the same seat of 3F, once again, GREAT SEAT with FULL recline and FULL foot/legrest as well as seat 3D. New update of Allegiant B757, Seat 3ABC, even though it says legroom+, it is not, its still the worst with only 29 inch pitch, row 4 has the most legroom+ than any other legroom+ seats with 36 inch pitch while other legroom+ has 34 inch pitch. Row 12 to 40 is regular with 31 inch pitch except 12F and row 31 is considered legroom+ due to no seat in front of it, Seat 2AC is giant seat with no reclide and no foot/legrest as well as 11AC, seat 11DE is considered legroom+ with still no recline as well no seats on Allegiant has recline except for 3DF on their B757 aircrafts. 3DF is best seat on all Allegiant B757, so book early if want those seats.

Best seat in entire plane, 3D & 3F is only seats that reclines with foot/legrest. Beware of no recline of other seats. 3A, 3B, & 3C is the very worst seats on plane with only 29 inch pitch, row 4 to 10 has 34 inch pitch, row 12 to 40 has 31 inch pitch. Book very early for 3D & 3F for best comfort as they sell quickly!

I don't fly much so I like a window seat to take pictures. Seat 23F is a very nice seat. It is behind the wing and there is room to take pictures. Sometimes I like to get part of the wing in the photo for perspective and this was a great spot. The seats are quite comfortable and I'm not a small person.
Once again, I flew to HNL again on Allegiant seat 3F, continues to be great comfortable best seat in the entire plane.
Once again, GREAT COMFORTABLE SEATS! Continues to be the best seat on this aircraft.

Flew from Grand Rapids MI to Mesa Az on  Saturday Jan 11, 2014 Allegiant Air no problems.Scheduled to return on Sunday  Jan 19, 2014 could not get a flight until Thurs Jan 23.  Constant texts sent to my phone on Sun 19 th kept changing departure times rthen cancelled.  Had to go to airport found out we were bumped for a Momday flight and the next flight was on Thursday.  No excuses or reasons, they said they were contract employees.  Unable to,call airlines on two different phone numbers.Worst experience we have ever had with an airline.  Beware Do Not Fly Allegiant Air!!!  You have been warned!!!

The plane was very loud, Talking with my wife was difficult. If you need something to drink, it costs you, including water. There is no customer service. At least none you can reach by phone. Views from rows 35, 36 & 37 are completely blocked by the planes engines, something ALLEGIANT does not tell you nor show you on the seating chart.

Flew Allegiant from Plattsburgh N.Y. to Sanford, Fla. on 03-16 had a smooth on time flight, plane was spotless; back on 03-22,on Airbus A-320, also on time smooth flight. Seat backs do not incline limits comfort but I knew so all good. Stop complaining those who buy cheap and expect 1st class !

From other reviews I was somewhat lerie. But from the ticket counter. To checking , flight attendants and pilot...They were outstanding. The plane could have been a little cleaner. But the overall service was great ..We'd fly agian with them
I have used your airline a couple of times.  It suits my needs perfectly! Flights are short and the staff is great!
great way to get to the valley, non stop, good fares, great people, will use this airline many more times
Was my first flight ever.... Will fly with you'll again...
great airline with extremely low fares

The seats were too narrow and the legroom so tight that I could not sit with my legs forward - they had to be turned either to the right or left.  (I'm 5'10".)  My wife, who is 5'3", sat in the middle seat (E), and her knees were against the seat in front of her.  They discourage people from getting up or even attempting to stand by their seats because the aisle for the flight attendants' carts is barely wide enough for them to get through.

After a long flight, we both had swelling in our legs for several days after. 
The main cabin in this aircraft is a torture chamber if your flight is more than a couple of hours.

I am a 5'6 female weighing 138 pounds; I had adequate leg room because I had nothing to put under the seat in front of me; otherwise, there would have been a problem.  I slept through the entire flight so cannot comment on the entertainment; by the time I got to Miami from St Louis I was somewhat stiff; I am not sure if it was because of the seat or the air or a combination of both; I had difficulty resting my head against the window wall to sleep; that was very very uncomfortable and I really really wish I had my travel pillow; the seat was a little hard but not bad enough to complain about

In my 30 years of business travel this was the most uncomfortable seat I have experienced.  I am 6'2", and could barely fit into the seat.  My knees were touching the back of the forward seat, and when they reclined, I had to splay my knees into the next seat area.  No ability to lean forwards -- assuming the "crash position" would be physically impossible.  Little foot room with wider than normal floor mounts.  Beware of regular coach for flights longer than 1 hour.

This is the window seat (left side) on the exit row.  I was very happy with this seat.  Lots of legroom, the tray table pops out from the seat in front and despite there being no left arm armrest, there is an armrest, so to speak, on the exit door, which was perfectly fine.  The seat width was not restricted at all as all the armrests in this row can be pushed up into the seats.   I would definitely select this seat again.

We had 2A & 2C. This was much more comfortable that main cabin (w/ extra legroom) flight in same plane several days before. Much more room. Extremely attentive staff.  Glad tp have seat in 1st class as plane was delayed after boarding and left almost 2 hours late due to a/c malfunction. Plane was hot until fixed.  We were offered drinks and snacks repeatedly, unlike the folks in coach who only rec'd the 1 water (or juice) ration & no snack once flight started.

The flight was a short one hour long. Being 6ft 7 inches tall, I was concerned about leg room. I was pleasantly surprised with how much space there was. The only downfall is that the bulkhead goes all the way down to the ground. Fortunately, being in the aisle seat allows you to stretch your legs into first class. The middle and window seats would have been uncomfortable for tall individuals.

The pitch in the Main Cabin is 30", which is below the standard seat pitch. Seat width is 17.7 inches, which is above the standard seat width. Recline is 4", which is about standard. Entertainment was excellent. Service and food was good also.

WORST SEAT CONFIGURATION EVER FOR A 5.5 HOURS FLIGHT!!! I am 6 feet tall, and I will tell you, this was the worst experience I have ever had! What is AA doing with this poor configuration? Seats barely recline, pitch is narrow, cushions are not comfortable. From Bogota to Dallas is a mid night flight so you dont really care about food and entertainment.

The economy seats are tight at 30 inch pitch. I am 5.10 and it was very uncomfortable after about a hour.Service was ok But beverages only. These are new seats and aircraft so they are very clean and well kept.My seat cushion was already out of line and added to the discomfort.

It is sad to see that AA changed its 757 and 767 in the routes to Colombia for this small cockroaches planes. It is worst than a Cattle car; Turbulence in this small A319 feels horrible and the comfort is very bad.

Seat Legroom:  Outstanding legroom as there is no seat in front of you.
Seat Recline:  Perhaps the seat I got was faulty, but there was minimal recline
Seat Width:  Narrower than the standard seat because the seat tray is built into the armrest.  Both armrests are immovable. There is one window that is positioned just  a bit forward of the shoulders when sitting back in the seat.  There is an emergency exit door in-line with row 22, but row 23 is not cold on your feet. Things to be aware of:  if you are flying on a red-eye, the bathroom in that area is bothersome, not because of the noise, but because when the door opens the light shines right down on row 22DE and 23DEF.  I found it to be an annoyance, and would probable choose 23A next time I have the option.

This is a Premium Seat, but it does not recline, the seat width is narrow, and the center arm rest can not be moved out of the way.  Because this seat faces the exit aisle their is a clear area of approx. 4-ft in front of you.  However there is nothing to rest your foot on, and when you stretch out without being able to recline it becomes very uncomfortable, even more uncomfortable on a long flight.  You end up with a sore back.  AA advised me that this seat reclined and had a movable armrest, this information is incorrect.  Seat 11 F was removed from our plane, and  a flight steward's folding seat has been installed which faces the back of the plane.

This is a Premium Seat, but it does not recline and the center arm rest can not be moved out of the way.  Because this seat faces the exit aisle their is a clear area of approx. 4-ft in front of you.  However there is nothing to rest your foot on, and when you stretch out without being able to recline it becomes very uncomfortable, even more uncomfortable on a long flight.  You end up with a sore back.  AA advised me that this seat reclined and had a movable armrest, this information is incorrect.  Seat 11 F was removed from our plane, and  a flight steward's folding seat has been installed which faces the back of the plane.

Hard side fixed solid panel arms containing trays - Do not extend out to allow easy use of Laptop keyboard if working. Moved to 7F reasonable normal legroom plus seat back tray. There are no TV screens in A320 so bring an iPad onboard
good flight

First I’d like to say are the videos online of First Class look amazing, that being said, I was  disappointed . I was expecting a screen on the seat in front of me where I can watch videos or the route we were flying. There was nothing! There was a  blanket but no pillow on my seat ,  but that was no big deal since I didn’t use either one.  I had the spinach pasta dish which was very good and there was something with an olive on it but I didn’t know what it was. Next was the warm chocolate chip cookie was very good.  My seat was nice and wide but when it comes to getting up was a  different story . The armrest  between the seats are long and makes it hard to get out from the  window seats if the seats in front of you are reclining back. I spilled a drink.  All in all I would not waste money on a first class accommodations.

Seat Legroom:  Outstanding legroom as there is no seat in front of you.
Seat Recline:  Perhaps the seat I got was faulty, but there was minimal recline
Seat Width:  Narrower than the standard seat because the seat tray is built into the armrest.  Both armrests are immovable. There is one window that is positioned just  a bit forward of the shoulders when sitting back in the seat.  There is an emergency exit door in-line with row 22, but row 23 is not cold on your feet. Things to be aware of:  if you are flying on a red-eye, the bathroom in that area is bothersome, not because of the noise, but because when the door opens the light shines right down on row 22DE and 23DEF.  I found it to be an annoyance, and would probable choose 23A next time I have the option.   There was no IFE on the aircraft I flew on.

Row 1 in First Class is not recommended. Take a seat in row 2 or 3 instead. I had a very comfortable flight in 3F from LA to Honolulu but the red-eye return was not pleasant at all. After 1 hour I didn't know where to put my legs (and I'm by no means tall). Very talkative cabin crew up front, my wife had to get up and ask the ladies to please lower their voices. We had 2 more flights on AA that long day and those were excellent.

I am 6'2", 190lbs.  This seat was actually quite comfortable.  I had a couple of inches between my knees and the next seat.  When the person in front of me leaned back the TV screen did get pretty close but I could still watch my movie and my legs were still comfy.  I had an isle seat because I thought I might need to stretch my legs, but I think next time I could handle a window seat so I could lean over and sleep.

12A, 12B, 12C are listed on American website as exit row for extra $, when in fact they are not - they are one row behind the exit row (Row 11) with no additonal room vs premium economy. American considers the left side of row 12 an exit row despite the fact that there is no exit path in this row.

Great exit row seat as no seat in row 11 enhancing extra legroom.  No complaints on service or staff.  My only complaint is that the overhead bins above rows 12-17 were used by rear seat passengers.  I had to disturb 5 rows of passengers behind me to access my luggage when departing.

When the person in front of you reclines you can hardly get out of your seat.  Old plane, cigarette ash tray is built into bathroom door.   Booked second row so I could keep my purse with me.  Seat was a nice size, no power outlet.   Best thing about this plane was the steward.
Very nice flight.  MCE seats had lots of leg room.  Very comfortable seats.  Entertainment screens worked good and Enjoyed a movie.
The seat was OK, but the flt. was bad :-( very poor service and only had overhead screen with one movie.

First time flying American in ye s
