We flew in on the 31st oct to Riga.The aircraft was brand new and very nice with it's white interior and white seats.The overhead cabins were very spacious and the seats sat comfortably.
When you flip up the arm rests you can easily lay down because the seats let you and the arm rests flip over completely.
Beware : on our return flight we had a similar aircraft and it was suppose to be new but it was slightly different eg the overhead cabins seemed smaller.

Plane seems to be brand new. 14 is the exit row on this model. The seats are okay but a bit hard. but the seat backs do not offer a lot of storage capability which is bad if you have an iPad or notebook you would like to stow. Also the plane is very noisy so get some ANC Headphones

Present seat map for AirBaltic CS-300 is wrong. They have capacity 145 not 150. So only 29 seat rows in plane present and row number for emergency exit is 14 and not 12.
I have flown many times on this type aircraft from AirBaltic and always uses row 14 for extra space for my legs.

Nothing to complain about, baggage drop-off was smooth, cabin was clean and seat was good, enough space for this 2 hours flight, the aircraft was new. Both flights were on time, onward and the return flight too. There is nothing to complain about, they do like other airlines too.
The seat was without recline on 6h flight, the only reconciliation for that was that we had 3 seats at our disposal. For my height (173), foot space was enough.
First time on this model of aircraft. I am 6-foot-5 and it was extremely tight on seating space, both legroom and seat width. Avoid long flights.

Excellent. Really comfortable aircraft. Plenty of room in economy seats and the overhead storage is massive. 
Love the big windows.
Business class is amazing. And, naturally, first 3 rows have bigger pitch than Economy. So, indeed, the map/info is still wrong.
Window seat on the left side of the plane with only one other seat between you and the aisle due to the 2-3 configuration.
Plenty of legroom, large windows, fairly quiet cabin, and lovely small screens with flight and airline information.
Absolutely no leg room i could not move an inch for 3 hours, total hell. Im 6ft and my knees touched the seat in front whatever position i sat in.

Vol retardé de prêt de 2 heures. Peu de place pour les jambes. Sourire des PNC "low-cost" également.
Service payant à bord. Même pas un verre d'eau.

Worst flight in 30 years. The pitch was even less than I have found elsewhere with insufficient room to get my knee to rear between the seat in front and behind. I am 6'4" but still this has never happened before on hundreds of flights. It seems that they had squashed an extra row in between about 17 and 21 on the LHS compared to the right. I could not get both my legs beneath the seat in front either. Excruciating >3 hrs. Lady in front insisted on trying to recline, etc. To make it worse I had been sold a "premium economy" experience.  This evidently consisted of the worst seat in the plane coupled with a free, inedible box sandwich and water bottle. This was a codeshare with AF - who should be ashamed/avoir honté.

Great Flight Cabin crew very friendly and Professional Ordered inflight meal and was very impressed one of the best meals I've ever had on an aircraft
I will be flying AirBaltic again FANTASTIC
Initially in 5A, beware this seat has no window.  Kindly the crew let me move to 7A which was much better!
Very narrowed seat with very poor ocnmfort
No complaints about this seat.
tallinn!
Good, new plane, quiet for a turbo prop. plane. Smooth in the air, ok amount of leg room for a taller man.
air baltic Q400 seatmap is wrong. Seating is A and C (double seat) and D and F on the other side of the aisle
an excelent view to the engine and rotating blades

Seat 3A has a well aligned window for great views of Mt Etna for the most common take-off direction from Catania. Of the extra leg room rows for which AB charges a premium, Row 3 seems to have more room on top. On my flight in late March 2017, most of these rows only had 1 or 2 passengers per side.
They have 1 or more planes with a A-seat in row 25.(I booked 26A, but was moved auomaticly few days before departure)

Flew Virgin on air berlin.  we sat in the five rows of extra leg room which was very spacious the leg room is excellent.  however in economy the seating looks horrendous very very tight space.  if you can try to book extra leg room.  Make note there are only five rows of EX Leg  room from row 15 to 19.

Seat was a bit uncomfortable, due to age and a bar which was across the middle of my back, close proximity to the bulkhead and bassinets.
Food was alright and there was plenty of legroom, infotainment was pretty good with latest films, Virgin usual high standards.
Business Class on A330-200
space for hand luggage limited due to aircraft stuff (emergency beacon, blankets...). Two windows, no toilett so noone walking around
Legroom has been ok for a short flight of one hour. Of course, all is quite tight, it is a quite small plane.

I flew to Noumea on the QF361 codeshare (actual flight is SB141). The A320 seems to be getting a little old now, as the interior is tired. The economy seat is typical of any A320 I've been on.AirCalin is a full service airline, so you get a full meal service on this 2 hour 50 minute flight. Qantas codeshare passengers are all placed between rows 14 and 20. I would have expected the cabin crew to speak at least some English given they were flying from Sydney, but apparently they did not (other than the CSM who did the announcements).The meal was pasta with chicken and vegetables, a potato and turkey salad, some chocolate cake, a TimTam and a bread roll. You could have red or white wine, whiskey (unknown brand) and soft drink. The chicken and pasta was very untasty. It reminded me of the type of meals you used to get on long haul flights in the 80s and 90s. I didn't bother eating it, knowing once I got to Noumea I could have a nice French meal.Entertainment is drop down screens.If you are flying this route, try to go on one of the days it's operated by Qantas. At least you'll get a refurbished 767-300 or most likely a 737-800.

Plane is a bit aged (the A320's in the AirCalin fleet are 10+ yrs old) but still a comfortable experience. Food wasn't on-par with other international business class but it's a sub 3hr flight so suck it up. Entertainment is a single screen for the cabin but there are about 12 audio channels (most in french). There's no english channel for the entertainment which is weird and you can't plug your own speakers into the sockets as they provide ready plugged in seinheisser headphones.Everyone speaks french and everything is french on the plane... the plus side of that was the wines... I love a full-bodied cab sav so the 2008 margaux blend and a nice 2011 syrah which I forget the name of.

It's shocking that a flight that long had no tv screens. We have been travelling around the world and it's our first experience with this. We could use our own devices but the battery life runs out especially when you are at the airport 3 hrs before using your devices. The food was the absolute worst we had. I'm not sure the chicken dinner was even chicken. We couldn't begin to eat it. Whereas on other flights the chicken was great. The attendants were super nice. The magazines were only in French though. On an "international" flight maybe some English ones would be a good idea. Old old plane. So different from other airlines.

Two of us flew from Auckland to Noumea and then back again a week later on the A320. The staff were friendly and smiley. On the way over we received an enjoyable lunch meal of meat and veg etc. There wasn't any choice but it was pleasant and the drinks (except Champagne) are free. On the return journey we were given a big breakfast - pain au chocolate, fruit, omelette and bacon. Seats were normal - perfectly comfortable for the 3 hour flight. They do recline and have the regular amount of legroom. We would happily fly Air Calin again.

Small but ok for a 2.5 hr flight. We were delayed on the Tarmac for 2hours! All packed in like sardines. Don't know why. Told some safety procedure at Sydney airport as we watched 3 firemen, 2 police and baggage men standing around laughing and not appearing to do much.
Annoying as told 30 minute delay initially. Then told another 20 minute delay. Was in all 2 hours. No reason given for long delay other than we needed to refuel after the wait.
Exit row seat so loads of legroom.  No entertainment on the flight.   Good food during the flight
lots of legroom as it was an exit row seat.  No entertainment good food andservice

Excellent seat with all of the frills. A lie flat seat, tho’ the flight was only two and a half hours. Two windows. I didn’t check the entertainment options other than music- Beethoven all the way with very good noise canceling headphones. They came in a zipped case with little paper caps ( hygiene I suppose).
Excellent service and food. French champagne, of course.
Frankly, I could have just kept on flying across the Pacific.

Plane is comfortable for a  two and half hour flight. Although almost full, cabin service was good.  Food was reasonable, Video screen in the rear of the seat in front  makes it very difficult to watch and almost impossible to use if the seat in front is reclined.

It was okay, i guess, I flew this airline both ways in the same seat on a school trip, they served drinks and a snack. I played cards with my friends. The seats were assigned so im glad i did not get stuck with row 20, even i noticed that the seat behind me had very little leg room. The people behind us had there knees into our seats. I did not use the recline. I say the seat width and pitch were standard. NO IN FLIGHT ENTERTAINMENT. Ride was very smooth

Seats were of average size and leg room was enough for me (I'm 6'1"). I was seated next to an overweight person, so I was a little bit squeezed but not uncomfortably. Although there was no inflight entertainment, AirTran does provide wifi service for a small fee so I used that to keep myself busy. Both flights were very smooth, no turbulence at all.

Air Tran has always been a good airline. This flight was'nt too out of the ordinary, but it was not a bad flight either. I do prefer the Delta DC-9-50 better than the 717, athough I do prefer the 717 more than the CRJ-700. This was in May of 2010.

The seats are nice. The extra leg room is nice for me I'm 6'4". THe drinks that you get are basicly "unlimited" as you are close to the storage room and are in the best seats. THe snacks are also better than the coach. GO TRAN!!
This was an AirTran flight. Seat was quite comfortable. Upgrades to business class are not outrageous and are worth every cent. Service was quick and responsive.
very nice would fly them again love the $59.00 tickets
Please add your seat comments here.
I've flown on it in 2006.

It was an OK experience. It was smaller than I expected. There was really no entertainment other than magazines. The snacks and and drinks were very delicious. Their cookie is the best I have ever tried. The seats were brown leather, but a little small. Later they asked me to fill out a form for their service. I thought it was a great flight, but a little weak in the parts listed above.

I was prepared to be critical of this based on the community dislike of losing their 737's.  I am delighted to say I like this plane.  It was comfortable, quiet, good overhead bin area, and quick.  Sometimes you just have to try something before complaining.   Thanks for a smooth ride.
Comfortable seats lots of knee room. Very friendly service. My guess not a bad seat on the plane. Maybe noisy by the wings as it's a prop plane. Totally would fly again this on these planes.
very good flight for this type of flight. seat 20 d is very good.
WORST FLIGHT EVER! this airline sucks! it was a long flight 7 hours. no food!! (you had to buy it) water, 6 dollars!!! hot meal 1 dollars!!! there wasnt any entretainment!

The seats of this aircraft were really comfortable. Plus the service was really good. I really don't know much about Alaska Airways but this flight was quite impressive. The food was good, and the flight attendant was nice with every body. The plane did not have a good entretainment system.
Limited range of drinks available, no food (not even creackers). Nothing to complain, nothing to highlight.

even though I was traveling economy the services were super..like if I was in business wine was serve with the dinner,coctail beer anything I want, why paid for business, when I can have the same service in coach.
Beware all B seats in the section that can be transformed in Business Class are very small and have almost no cushion. Ypou may be seatong on the seat belts connections to the seat.
These B seats are the worst. Never choose them. Go for the aisles or windows. They are narrower and you feel protrusions all over your body.
Totally Disgusting Seat for Business Class although apparently, this is what you get in Europe. Dirty Aircraft and Lazy Flight Attendants. Would never Recommend Alitalia to anyone.

Passengers themselves are inconsiderate. During meal times many did not return their seats to their original position unless the flight attendant asked them to move their seats. I paid extra to choose window seats for my family and self. There was no difference. The aisle space is so limited that you need to be vigilant to avoid getting hit by service cart or people walking. The crew was aloof and did their require service for meals, nothing more, nothing less. At the moment of collecting the luggage someone had taken it and thanks to recognizable ID we were able to retrieve it. There should be supervision at the exit to prevent stolen luggage. Overall experience was terrible. If traveling to Europe again will avoid choosing Alitalia

I paid extra for this seat which is characterized as a comfort seat. Alitalia actually billed me twice. The seat has a three inch wide plastic panel attached to the inside of the aisle side of the seat.  It was impossible for this 75 year old to sit down! The person in the window seat switched with me. I have NEVER been so uncomfortable on an airplane and I have flown a lot! Never again on Alitalia! Video monitor was broken and would not stay upright.

Alitalia economy plus is a joke, very uncomfortable seats, mediocre food and gost hostess. No good entertainment, no amenity kit, no WiFi as they advertise. Very rude crew. My footrest was broken, the hostess told me tha she will send a men, nobody came, I stayed all flight with the foot rest half open. Nobody around if you need a drink or anything. The seats are smaller of other premium economy airlines, but you are paying more, it is not worth it!!!

The aircraft was comfortable.  The service was good.  There was effort put into the preparation of the food.  The cabin was a little warm, and the touchscreen was difficult to operate, but THE FLIGHT ARRIVED ON TIME - IN FACT A LITTLE EARLY.  These days, that deserves an A+.

The space feels a little cramped. All replace absolute privacy and perfectly level and comfortable seat for sleeping. The food was excellent. Flight attendant feels a little impersonal, laughter must enforce passenger. Serving and service in general was very brisk.
Excelente atención, pero los asientos son poco cómodos, igual estoy agradecida por la atención
A short flight so very difficult to assess full range of services but what we had was quite good.
Just not even close to the comfort and service of our return flight, which was on Delta.

We took the same flight 2 years ago and were extremely uncomfortable for 12 hours. We were really afraid to try it again, but were very pleasantly surprised at the improvement. The plane appeared new compared to the old clunker we took 2 years ago. There was MUCH more legroom and seat width. The seats reclined much further at a better angle and were much softer and more comfortable. NO backache!  They fed us 3 times on the way home and 2 or 3 times on the way there (I can't remember). The food was okay/adequate. I don't expect gourmet food on a plane. It was fine. The service was excellent. Everyone was cheerful and pleasant. There was a drink station set up with an ICE bucket, so you could get your own soft drinks, juice, and water when you wanted it. The entertainment system was pretty good. I found the music to be either to difficult for me to figure out or there just wasn't much to choose from There were plenty of movies and TV shows. The games were outdated. Check in in Rome took too long, but they got us through in time. The plane left 30 minutes late, but most planes don't leave on time, at least in my experience. Great flight overall. We travel a few times a year by plane for the last 20 years. Not frequent travelers, but a lot to compare this flight with.

This row is actually an exit row; the seat width is a bit smaller and the armrests are immovable.  The window seat(L) is a bit confining -   This said, the seats were just fine for us, given that we had infinite leg room, and could get up at any time without bothering anyone.   Also located by the bathroom, which was convenient, and we were not disturbed at any time.  The TV was a small box that came out the left side of the armrest, and the tray table comes out of the arm rest also.  The table was totally convenient.  We did not watch TV,  the screen was small and we were tired.  The crew were very helpful and friendly.  I do not hesitate to recommend this aircraft and airline.

Unable to check-in in advance either via website or at the airport self service machines (customer service later told me this was because I had a connecting flight with another skyteam partner... even though the connecting flight had an AZ code).Awful seat. The photos tell the story (and I am only 160cm / 5ft 3in) - how any airline can think it acceptable to have passengers sit with a metal box at their feet for over 13hours is beyond me.

Una agradable sorpresa. A pesar de que el equipo utilizado por Alitalia es muy viejo, mi sorpresa fue su estado. Bastante bien. Los asientos aunque viejos estuvieron muy cómodos. La atención de la tripulación fue excelente. Los alimentos y las bebidas de primera. Un café capuchino muy bueno. El servicio de lo mejor. Lo que está un poco deficiente es su sistema de entretenimiento pero como fue vuelo nocturno ni lo usé casi Felicidades Alitalia.

This seat was just the average seal. Cloth not leather thin cushion bottom with descent recline for economy. This section of row has not window so it would be great for laying head and sleeping. Entertainment system was under seat A & B  but there was not a 3rd leg separating making legroom OK in all 3 seats. Have to say Alitalia has the worse flight attendants I have ever encountered.

Row 16 is shown in red (beware) presumably because the seat doesn't recline fully. Actually, row 16 is the best row in Economy Plus. To recline, the seat back does not tilt back (and hit the bulkhead behind it), but instead the seat bottom slides forward. This method provides the increased tilt promised in Economy Plus and does not interfere with the row, or bulkhead behind it.
Row 15 is missing a window.  Each of the three rows in Economy Plus have two windows except for row 15, which has only one.

El problema de todos los ansientos de ventanilla es esa molesta caja metálica que impide estirar las piernas.  No se qué función cumple esa caja allí. Además tiene  una alta temperatura, lo que hace menos confortable el viaje. El menu sin gluten no es bueno. Y tampoco hay colaciones libres de gluten.

Our leg room was great, the seats are very small not to good on cushens. Right next to the bathrooms alot of people hanging around you not to quiet. Would do another airline I feel sorry for the other people in regular seats. I would never fly in them seats. I had exit seats.

It was very hard to find a comfortable position with alitalias classica seat. With the flight being 12 hours the seat was very uncomfortable and the entertainment system was out of date but still worked which was ok. The recline seemed generous having flown so many domestic flights.

If rows 1-4 are available, as was the case for me, book a seat here as lots of legroom. No extra cost. Seems their availability varies and no logic to it- coming back, seats in front of row 9 all booked; but they were in fact empty pretty much, in reality. Row 11 are exit seats, for £20 extra.Was a comfortable flight, and LCY is a great airport.

In one word - CRAMPED.  No hip room & No leg room.
No coffee?????  Why not?
People in row 3 had to put carry-ons as far back as rows 7 or 8; causing a lot of traffic in the aisle.
What a great improvement over the old MD80.Lots of room. Great flight

This was a great airplane with hardly any turbulence and the noise level wasn't bad. The seats weren't comfortable but the service was ok. The Airline finds lots of ways to get money out of you. I'm not flying this airline anytime soon.

I'm back, I have complete my trip sitting in the same seat of 3F, once again, GREAT SEAT with FULL recline and FULL foot/legrest as well as seat 3D. New update of Allegiant B757, Seat 3ABC, even though it says legroom+, it is not, its still the worst with only 29 inch pitch, row 4 has the most legroom+ than any other legroom+ seats with 36 inch pitch while other legroom+ has 34 inch pitch. Row 12 to 40 is regular with 31 inch pitch except 12F and row 31 is considered legroom+ due to no seat in front of it, Seat 2AC is giant seat with no reclide and no foot/legrest as well as 11AC, seat 11DE is considered legroom+ with still no recline as well no seats on Allegiant has recline except for 3DF on their B757 aircrafts. 3DF is best seat on all Allegiant B757, so book early if want those seats.

Best seat in entire plane, 3D & 3F is only seats that reclines with foot/legrest. Beware of no recline of other seats. 3A, 3B, & 3C is the very worst seats on plane with only 29 inch pitch, row 4 to 10 has 34 inch pitch, row 12 to 40 has 31 inch pitch. Book very early for 3D & 3F for best comfort as they sell quickly!

I don't fly much so I like a window seat to take pictures. Seat 23F is a very nice seat. It is behind the wing and there is room to take pictures. Sometimes I like to get part of the wing in the photo for perspective and this was a great spot. The seats are quite comfortable and I'm not a small person.
Once again, I flew to HNL again on Allegiant seat 3F, continues to be great comfortable best seat in the entire plane.
Once again, GREAT COMFORTABLE SEATS! Continues to be the best seat on this aircraft.

My Experience of flying Etihad  (Jul 15th, 2018), started with a serious negative impression, when my seat allocation was done by Etihad automatically, and despite my "Aisle" seat preference, I was allotted a middle seat from BLR to Abu Dhabi, and a window seat from Abu Dhabi to JFK. When I asked for an aisle seat at the time of checkin, I was shamelessly asked to shell out more money, which I declined.
Having said that, the overall experience from Bangalore to Abu Dhabi was FORGETTABLE to say the least, though the flight experience from Abu Dhabi to JFK was nothing to complain about (except the window seat).
I would specifically want to talk about my flight experience from Bangalore to Abu Dhabi. The cabin crew I met was MOST RUDE that I ever met. They served the mandatory food yes, besides they were just not ready to ask for any drink, leave aside if I needed something beyond that. When I got tired of waiting, I asked them to get me a black coffee, and the crew never returned. After waiting for 40 mins, I asked them again and voilla, the reply was that we were descending, hence not possible. WOWWWWWWWWW. I got agitated enough to tell the lady that if she were to get me my drink at the correct time, it would have been much before we started descending.
The crew made no bones to hide their irritation towards all passengers overall, as I was not the odd person out.
Would not fly ETIHAD if I have any other choice to fly.
Rgds

Sameer

After reading some negative comments about Etihad Airways, both staff, service and food, it was with some trepidation , that we booked with Etihad.
The lounge at Heathrow has now gone under a concession, but it was excellent, to my mind better than BA.
Boarding was on time and the seat on the upper deck was fine, amenities were OK, not first class.
Pre flight drinks and snacks were fine ,and a menu was produced for lunch, with a good selection, and a choice of times to eat.
Food and wine were first class, and service excellent, so different from some reviews, but I find if you treat cabin staff well they will treat you well !
Flight was perfect and we arrived on time ,I would recommend this airline.

DOH-ABU-SYD- A320/A380. Doha gate staff horrible; flight Attendants to ABU; great.
ABU-SYD-A380- I switched seats once on board from 20E, to 19H, for a window. ( Rear-facing seat ) Three FA's knew I had changed seats, yet I was completely ignored during the meal service, for 30 minutes. I had to walk to the galley and ask for something, and the response was defensive. ( If this is Business Class treatment; what is First like?) The seat/bed/entertainment was excellent on the nearly 13 3/4-hour flight. When I finally received some, the food was well-presented and delicious. Thankfully, it was an award ticket; I would not pay cash, for that poor treatment.

Booked Etihad Business class to try Etihad for a change - and to specifically to try their new Dreamliner and A380. They changed the plane to older planes on both of our flights (first one was to Dusseldorf via Abu Dhabi from Colombo) - food service lacking on both legs of London to Bangkok. London lounge great, Abu Dhabi lounge way too busy very late at night and early in the morning, couldn't get a shower before boarding time, despite very helpful attendent trying 3 different areas. Very dissapointing experience all round. Will use other airlines in future (so, it seems they don't care about Business customers either!)

I sat in Economy. Plane was new. Entertainment had plenty of options and screen was very responsive. Seat was comfortable and spacious - I prefer to keep my luggage in the seat in front (as I'm short usually can't reach the overhead storage!) - normally this means I have to rest my feet on my bags, but this time I had plenty of space! The headrest was comfortable, much better than most airlines. My only complaint would be the service, which was hit and miss on this long-haul flight - some stewards were very attentive and polite, others a little too snappy and unapologetic.

Boarding was great. Located in seat 61F with my wife in 61G we really enjoyed the legroom available. This I believe is much longer than BA and even Emirates. Overhead compartment was sufficient enough for our 2 hand luggage but bear in mind that the overhead compartment for Swarts in row 62 is for the crew so you will find customers in row 62 will put their luggage in 61 luggage compartment. Double screen for inflight entertainment and comfortable seats, take off and landing was lovely on this carrier in comparison to others and night flight is the best.

A380 very disappointed. Always wanted to travel on one with Etihad. Take off and landing was amazing bit that was all.
Flight crew on the way out were verging on rude, condescending and very aloof. Food was pretty awful, hot drinks were luke warm and pretty unpalatable. The toilets were disgusting, dirty wet toilet paper all by washbasin and on the floor. Told more than one cabin crew about it and was virtually ignored. Disappointing experience overall. Probably won't use Etihad again.

Not sure of exact seat no. but was aisle seat (of x4). Seat felt cramped, seat squab only came half way along my thigh and I'm short! Overall the experience (my first) with Etihad was dreadful. Crew unprofessional, even go as far as dysfunctional.Food poor & uninspiring, service on board and on ground not good. Follow up communication from customer service (to date, 2 months after flight) non existent

Le meilleur vol de notre vie. Alors que nous partons aux 4 coins du monde depuis des années. Le personnel était souriant et très professionnel contrairement aux avis lus. Les toilettes sont nettoyés en cours de vol. Les boissons de très bonne qualité. Le lounge avant le départ à Paris : génial. Le fast track pour les formalités de douane à l'arrivée : impeccable ! Nous nous réjouissons pour le retour.

22A is a forward facing window seat in Business. Privacy is lacking as there is no extendable divider for this seat (and all A seats). All A/C & H/K seats in Business have only 1 side-wall storage compartment that can be opened, even though there are 3 compartments per seat. My seat in particular has shown some wearing and could use some fresh up. The seat cusion could be better.

Overall I rate this flight as pretty good.  By the end of it I fealt like I had  made a number of new friends (The Cabin crew!)  Around about 3am a number of passengers were stretching their legs & talking in the rear area D.  One of the cabin crew kept offering us some great snacks & it felt like we were having a party! Having said that tho, their are still some things that could be improved on:- 1. the wait for drink & food at the start of the flight for food & drink was quite long.  We took off at about 8.30pm & around about 10.30 were eating a full meal.  Because a number of us were from NZ, our bodies were crying out for sleep not food.  Although earplugs, headphones & eye covers were available, the cabin lights were not dimmed until after all the empty plates etc. were collected.  At this point in the 14Hr. flight (total predicted journey time of 34 hr.s) I really started to wonder whether I would be able to cope.  Fortunately I eventually managed to get a short nap & this lifted my spirits somewhat.  In total I probably only slept 1.5 - 2 hr.s on this night flight! I am quite tall & had tried hard to check in 23h 55 min.s (5 min.s after the earliest time at which the process become available) before the flight commenced.  My experience with their website was very frustrating & in fact somewhat scary!! I selected a seat with extra legroom (which was supposed to be available, but when I tried to move to the next screen I receiver an error msg informing me that the seat was not available & to try again.  After a number of repetitions I, in desperation, tried to select my original seat number & this was not available either!!  I then clicked the back arrow to see what seat No, I now had,  The field was blank! so it looked as if all I had achieved (by staying up pretty late to access the service) was to lose my seat allocation!!  The website was giving me false information & my original seat allocation was not changed !!  Why did I even try!!One other thing;-   There were 2 buttons on the side of the seat rest, initially it seemed that the rear 1 allowed me to recline the seat, with some difficulty.   Later on in the flight, it would not budge, even though there was room behind it.  Eventually I mentioned it to a crew member, they were successful in moving it.  It seemed that the front button was the correct one.  IT WOULD BE GOOD IF THIS information was provided in the literature freely available in the brochures in the front or maybe even announced at the end of the safety talk (until the written instructions become available)

I travel annually back home to Chicago from Abu Dhabi. Etihad is the logical and only choice for a nonstop flight. I am a tall guy with a knee problem, therefore, trying to sit in a middle seat is out of the question. Since I frequently travel, it has become a nightmare when I am ready to select a seat. I have tried the exit seat after paying extra (AED600 ea. way), but realized it didn't make a difference if someone is sitting next to you; you are still going to be cramped in the seat. on other trips, I selected seat 52K (paid extra ea. way). I selected this seat because the seat in the Plan appeared to have a "space" from the other seat (this is a twin seat row), but to my surprise, the seats were abutted but away from the window, which didn't make any sense to me especially that I paid extra for this not so "preferred" seat!
I guess what I am complaining about is the seat width needs to be considered by Etihad especially for long flights such as Chicago; 14hrs outbound and 13.5hrs inbound. My other complaint is the food; since 90% of the passengers are Asians, Etihad should have considerations for those who prefer non-spicy food. In addition, if you choose to sit in the rear by the aisle, it is going to be a bothersome people bumping onto you, service carts and the worse; people queuing waiting to go to restroom especially after meals!

The flight was very good in all aspects. The cabin crew were all courteous from the moment we boarded to deplaning. My meals were served hot and was tasty however the sandwich served was very dry I was not impressed. They served water throughout the flight and also had snacks. There was a selection of movies and shows. Although my seat was the last row in the first cabin I was pleasantly surprised it reclined and how much it reclined.There is sufficient legroom for me but if you are taller there would be an issue. The seat width is comparable to other airlines. The 26th row is just in front of the toilets but fortunately I did not have any issues with stench or people lining up to use it perhaps being an overnight flight had something to do with it.

This flight/seat was a travesty.13 hrs of having every person and or cart hit and sometimes smash into my shoulder meant that if I never fly this airline again it will be too soon.I felt sorry for the flight attendants who have to try and navigate the carts down the isles that have been restricted due to the 3-4-3 layout as opposed to most airlines using the logical 3-3-3. The FAs had to apologise to every passenger they run into, but by the end of the 13 hr flight it was up to you to watch out for the shoulder bashing overhang of the carts.

Plenty of leg room and seat very comfy with little interference from other passengers. Food was prompt and eat at your preferred time. Extremely attentive staff never needed to ask for anything. Drinks were filled up without asking. Staff first class and entertainment good too.
I travelled by Three Class Boeing.So the layout sent by you does not match.But 2 seaters are not inclinable like other seats,or in my aircraft the seats maybe defective.I travelled on 28-4-14
I USED TO FLY ONBOARD THIS TYPE OF AIRCRAFT 12 TIMES ON THIS ROUTE, 1 TO JEDDAH AND MORE THAN 20 FLIGHTS TO RIYADH. ITS MY FAVURATE AIRLINER. SERVICE IS EXCELLENT AS USUAL.

I would have expected more comfortable, lumbar-supported seats for a  13hr flight. The legroom was barely adequate; once  under-seat hand luggage was stowed, there was little room between it and the metal seat support for both feet. The food served, while hot and frequent, was primarily of Indian cuisine with no other option if this is not to your liking. I subsequently bought a chicken salad roll at Abu Dhabi airport and took it for my main meal on the return trip. The flight stewards were not friendly at all. Little information was given as regards meal content, and the passenger sitting on the aisle was frequently banged-into by the trolleys, with no acknowledgement or apology from staff. Drink variety was good, however there was no option of fresh fruit with meals. In-flight announcements were often spoken too quickly or too quietly, or  (in the case of English announcements) with a heavy accent, making it difficult to know what was said. The entertainment system assigned to my seat repeatedly crashed, taking 5/10 minutes on average  to reload. The plane was clean and well equipped.

I was on 38C but after the plane climbed and seatbelt sign turned off I saw row 32 was empty so I moved to 32A (paid legroom seat) and there I remained for the rest of the 7 hour flight.Service was efficient, with the flight delayed in take off the crew could have served the food a little quicker. The food itself was nothing to write home about, just good enough for this review. It do it's job though and kept the tommy from rumbling the rest of the journey. Main food was served after take off and a snack sort bun was served just before landing into AUH. In flight movie selection was good for this length journey, ended up watching 2 movies (don;t get time to see cinema so was a welcomed treat).One thing great I did see was their treatment of children and parents with babies, very good indeed. I have booked my next family holiday with them :)

Choose this seat since row 42 was available. This is comfortable with no equipment box unlike in Airbus 330/340  window seat. Plenty of leg space and decent recline of seat. Seat width is adequate and with this seat you get additional space along window due to its rear curve. This gap is very helpful to keep things and pillow also It's good to rest with nice thick pillow. Each seat power point is a big advantage for all device charging.

The service was very poor.  Food served very late.  Food was not up to our expectations and quality not what we paid for.  It takes more than 15 minutes for a crew to attend to our needs each time we call them.  We request for warm water either they give hot water or cold water.

PERTH TO ABU DHABI WAS GOOD: SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT AND ENTERTAINMENT COVERED ALL INTERESTS:ABU DHABI TO BELGRADE WAS GREAT: PLANE WAS MORE MODERN, SEATS WERE MORE COMFORTABLE: SERVICE WAS EXCEPTIONAL AND FOOD WAS FIRST CLASS:HAVE FLOWN SAME ROUTE WITH 2 DIFFERENT AIRLINES, ETIHAD WAS BETTER AND WILL FLY WITH ETIHAD AGAIN:

Service was very good staff/crew was very courteous . Seats were very comfortable. Departure time from Delhi is not good for passengers like me coming from Punjab . Otherwise I would love to travel Etihad and recommend it to every body.

My parents came on  EY 211 flight and seat was 28 J, 28 H
Seat was comfortable and Service was good , with the flight Food was good and my parents felt good with Hindu Meal.
It was superb experience. I am 6.1 tall with healthy body but I found it quite comfortable to sit and even stretch the legs.
Perfect flight on Time with an efficient crew. The s’est is cimfortable, the food was good and the choice of films large
IT WAS MY BEST FLIGHT EVER ONBOARD ETIHAD AND OTHER AIRLINERS. IT MAD MY VACATION UNFORGOTTABLE.

This is my business class flight with Etihad I normally fly business class with Emirates so I will be critical of Etihad standard.  The business class lounge was excellent with a small selection of hot and cold foods. Boarding was a disaster with economy and business mixed in the same long queue and only when we got to the boarding pass check point did we discover that the queues were supposed to be separate. Once On board it didn’t improve much with the cabin crew busy doing other stuff so we just found our own seats and worked it out for ourselves.
The Business class seats are firm but are narrow in comparison to other airlines. The food menu and wine selection is very limited to Meat, chicken or fish. The privacy screen is excellent.

Once we boarded the flight, the plane didn't take off.  After half an hour, we were informed that the flight will be delayed for 2 hours with no specific reason given.  No food were served during this time.  Children were hungry.  At least could have request us disembark the flight and be in the Airport so that we can go around duty free shops and relax in the Airport instead of in the flight.  No compensation
Good  seat. I found the B787-9 a very quiet aircraft. The air pressure was far superior to any  Airbus aircraft that I have flown
Good enough seat, but I find the B787-9 a very noise aircraft, also found the pressurisation not as good as  the Airbus 330
A little noisy due to proximity of engine. But,very comfortable seats, lots of storage areas, and very good service.
Great service!

First window seat for business class with a small kitchen gallery for drinks in front and the crew quarters and toilet on the other side.. One seat only on the windows staggered.  Not as close to the window as the even numbered seats. Having no one in front allow for extra storage space throughout the 14 hour flight on the benches. Lots of privacy from neighbours.

The seat itself is quite new and comfortable. It is a shame you can't control each individual window's darkness. The seat would be more comfortable in bed mode if they provide a thin mattress. The table is big, sturdy and won't get in the way of getting out of the seat, which is hard to find these days.
Just enough leg room for 1.5 hour flight but would not be very comfortable on a longer flight.  The crew aboard Eurowings was courteous and friendly.
very good, if there was a tv it would be better!!!
x

Todo el pasaje fue magnifico, atento y muy cordial, espacio bueno entre asientos, ofrecen agua o refresco , muy  puntuales , puedes subir troller y pequeño bolso sin problema, buen espacio para maletas. Me gusto la fila 1 , lo tendré en cuenta para la próxima, desde España numero de atención gratuito y eficaz ante las dudas, en ALEMANIA igual muy amables. Para un vuelo de hasta 5 horas asientos cómodos. La comida como todos ....no es ninguna maravilla, pero aceptable, les recomiendo sin duda, la mejor compañía bajo coste con la que he volado.

The ex Lufthansa A340-300 is an old, but verry nice and interessting airplane with a new Eurowings inside. The seat 4 K in the Eurowings BEST-class has lot of speace and is verry contribul, we will take Eurowings also for our next fligths to the USA

New Eurowings interior is nicely done, plenty of legroom

Economy seats are not that comfortable, toilets darkly lit

Cabin is very quiet, a big plus on longhaul flights

A bad flight.
First of all the plane is unbearably loud. I measured 106 dB Leq. In a normal working environment this wouldn't be allowed.
Row 6 is next to the propellers which makes it even worse (if possible).
The second problem was the cabin temperature. It was unbearably warm during boarding and taxing. The reason for this is that they use only one engine and the compressor is off. Maximum discomfort. When I asked to the stewardess to do something, she didn't even reply. Quite unprofessional.
Finally the cabin was dirty. I was the first one to use the toilet and you can see in the picture how I found it.
I promised myself never to board a Dash( ever again, especially with Eurowings. I used in the past with AirBaltic and the situation wasn't this tragic.

Seat just in front of the wingtips, right next to the mighty turboprop engines. Window seats have reduced outer legroom due to curvature of the cabin, but OK for me at 5'10". Pretty much no room for cabin baggage, anything 'larger' will be loaded and returned to you after the flight. Plan ahead if you want you valuable or sensitive items with you in the cabin.
Noise level is ok, normal in-ear headphones allow for listening to music, bring noise cancelling ones if you intend to watch a movie in-flight, there's no IFE. Tolerable levels of vibration, overall a pretty smooth flying experience.

PLEASE NOTE: The whole row 11 has no windows!
I'm a turboprop fan (no pun intended) but the Dash 8 is awfully loud. I measured an average of 96 dB SPL. Enough to force you to shout if you want to have a conversation with your neighbor.
Take off is always smooth, landing can be bumpy because of the slower speed compared to turbofans.
Probably the best seat is in row 10.

Note to myself: skip this flight next time ... especially seat 11A/F.
Apart from the very limited space (I'm 6'4 tall), the fresh air vents are 1-2 inches above my head, neck/head-ache guaranteed.
The 11F seat is not on a window, it's even worse, there is no place for the right shoulder as the right hand wall seems thicker right here (similar on the 11A seat).

Flight was rather loudas this airplane is a propeller plane.
The legroom at the window seats is quite bad.
The service on board was very good and the staff was very friendly. The flight itself was very bumpy because of the bad weather conditions.
The seats are rather uncomfortable an hard. It was ok for that short flight.

This is a great plane, cruising in excess of 700kmh and at a lower altitude.

Slightly loud compared to larger aircraft, however a very comfortable journey.

Obviously seat 1c has great legroom.

The aircrew were friendly and helpful.

Do not hesitate to fly in a Bombardier 400QC
The best Seat ,slot of jegroom in a good and comfortabel chair even for a langer person as I am.
Beware Row 11 has no window. View is extremely limited

Overall, I rate the flight excellent.  The seat was comfortable for the 2 hour flight to Manila.  Audio Video was excellent, although the screen a bit small.  I would like to see EVA put a foot rest in this particular business seat.    Otherwise, no issue and I had a good flight.

Quite often using this flight (BR62, BR61), as it is direct flight. I am 193 cm tall, so I am not that happy with legroom. Entertainment is good, always has some good movie to choose for make flight shorter. Food is always tasty, anyway not that big portion. No problem with additional drinks, or noodle soup. Staff is usually nice, anyway, you need to ask them yourself. Flight in general is quiet and relaxing, as it is mostly used by quiet Asians.
Eva Airways A330 has a great coach class. It features not only a great seat, but also a great personal entertainment system. Seats are abundant in space. Service is really poor.

I flew the Hello Kitty Jet (BR 857). The seat was really good. Lots of legroom, width, recline. I couldn't even choose from the vast variety of videos. Food portion was small though. No problem crossing 41J because the person sitting there was my dad. Apart from serving food, none of the flight attendants left the galley.

It was a really nice flight. When boarding, every cabin crew greeted us. They were nice, the food was also really good. Flight entertainment was really nice, because of all of the movies on flight. There were new movies too. So I recommend to fly with EVA Air.
Seat pitch is OK, entertainment is good but always be paused/interrupted by Public Announcement(PA), food is so so, service is fine.
I did not know what to expect but found the flight comfortable and ai was well served by excellent staff.
x

Really pleasant business class seat.  Full lie flat and very comfy.
Food was pretty good if some what fish driven.
First choice of meal wasn’t available which was disappointing having ordered it well in advance.
Mattress could have been thicker like in Emirates as during the night it became uncomfortable.
Everything asked for was delivered by excellent cabin staff.

EVA Air's Premium Economy is exactly that - economically priced but with premium services and amenities. My most recent flight on EVA Air's Premium Economy on BR17 SFO-TPE on April 1st was my wife's and mine 12th flights in 14 months starting in February 2017. We just love the wonderful services at affordable prices.

Very comfortable lie flat seats, on which it was possible to sleep for several hours! I am over 6 foot tall, but could still sleep fully stretched out. My only complaint is that the seats are a bit narrow.

I have back problems but when booking online there were no aisle seats available.  However i got to the airport bit early, check in was pain free no queue & the officer there was brilliant and got me aisle seats on both legs of my journey to LAX.Very spacious, clean and psychologically much more relaxed because of it..had a very long journey to get to my mother in Florida and at least the international leg was very comfortable.I even had the seat beside me free through the whole trip but the arm rest is fixed so no way to spread out there though it was useful holding all my junk whilst i did rest in my own seat:)I didnt enjoy the movie selection but thats a personal preference and i had my laptop so no problems.  Food was average (having been spoilt on SIA flights) but definitely acceptable.  I liked that the stewardesses walked around frequently actively looking to see if anyone needed anything plus walking around with trays of juice and water...absolutely essential on those long dry flights.

This will be the second time within a year that my wife and I have flown on this aircraft from London Heathrow to Bangkok. We have again booked economy class 63 A and B. We found the fight to be both a comfortable and very pleasant experience. We will be flying on the 24th. February 2011 and I will be celebrating my 65th. Birthday on 26th. February 2011. I can think of no better way of celebrating the start of my retirement other than by once again experiencing the feeling of being treated as someone special as I am sure all your other passengers do

I travelled with my wife and 14 year-old girl from HCMC to San Jose. The first leg from HCMC to Tapei there was not much to say as it was only a short flight but we were quite upset cause I was seperated from mom and daughter. Then, on the next flight from Tapei to San Francisco, our request (window-aisle-aisle seats on the same row)were not fulfill thougt we were able to seat together in the middle. Hopefully on the way back home, we'll get what we want.

Folks, Eva is a top notch airline and this is a top notch jet.  The service and facilities are spectacular.  There's no way you can fly economy on ANY US carrier and get this type of service.  The seats even in economy seem wider with much more space in front of you vs any US airline I've flown with.  EVA is my #1 choice for overseas travel.

Excellent seat and service. Flew to Asia on EVA and back on Cathay. Found EVA seat superior even though both were good.  EVA outshined with PJs and bed cover. Food was okay, service top notch.  The only area that needs improvement is movie and TV selection.  I had my iPad downloaded with some extra content so I was fine.

I 'm 67 . EVA is my favorite airline to USA Last year my seat was in the front . I  satisfied with long leg seat This year I will fly on Nov 2, I hope  to sit the same seat which I will  fly happily  with  EVA for ever
My 3rd leg on EVA and am very impressed with the service and the aircraft.  When flying overseas I will try to do it on EVA.  It was a treat compared to some of the USA companies.

Have been flying for over 50 years and this might have been the b est ever!
Outstaning in every way, the service, comfortable ecoomy,
the plane, and great fast schedule
1ST TIME TAKING EVA, AND GLAD TO KNOW THAT ROYAL LAUREL SEATS ARE FANTASTICALLY COMFY. I WOULD DEFINITELY FLY EVA AGAIN.
Economy class seats are very spacious compared to other carriers. Cabin is clean and service is excellent.

Service is smiling and friendly.  Business class was less than half full so it was extra pleasant. 
The blankets they provide are an almost full twin-size comforter.  Long enough and a nice weight.  Amenity kit had toothbrush, earplugs, sleep mask and socks.

The welcome drink was good, they offer plenty of bottled Fiji water throughout the flight.

The seat is all automatically controlled with buttons in the armrest.  The seat lowers and moves within a shell so there is no impact to anyone else around you from your seat being down.  There are a million ways to lower or recline the seat but in the most "flat" position, the leg rest rises from the seat and fills the foot well in front of you.  It is not flat and at times I felt like I was sliding down, but near the end of the flight I realized there was a foot rest I could have popped out  to prevent sliding.  There is plenty of leg room and you are not permitted to stow bags under the seat in front of you during takeoff and landing so empty what you need into all the storage cubbies available.

The TV is controlled by a remote control in the armrest.  VERY fast compared to Air Canada's touch screen system.

I'd avoid the first row of Business as you have the lights from the galley and noise from the galley.  Yes, there is a curtain but the every time someone uses the lav the lights shine on you or they bump you when they walk past.  4K worried me a bit on paper because I thought there might be reduced seat mobility in the last row but it ended up being great.

We thought we would spoil ourselves and fly on our first family holiday overseas on business class.
Less than satisfied.
Uncomfortable, well worn seats.
Good leg room.

Entertainment a joke, an IPAD! Dirty, cover that was old and tacky and didnt work properly.
Drink good.
Food nice but I expected better.
I wanted a certain dish that was offered on the menu to be told " We only have 2 of them". So didnt get it.
Staff were not overly happy.
Was surprised that when we went to land there was still food not picked up and they didnt even check if we had our seat belts on!
I looked up and they were putting their seat belt on!
We had a glass break near my 8 year old who knocked it of whilst sleeping and it broke. It was sitting there most of the flight.
Staff less than helpful and quite grumpy.
Would not fly business class with this airline ever again and  would not recommend to anyone.

Looked like a great seat BUT it is the ONLY window seat without a window! Very disappointed because we also booked this seat on return flight.
On flight over audio was not working.
On flight home I sat bolt upright in 19B (next to wife) as seat recline would not work. Hard to get comfortable.
Legroom adequate. Service very ordinary - still waiting to come back with a drink. Ran out of vegetarian dish (although everyone I saw had the chicken, no one had vegetarian). I had the chicken - like everyone else (not prepared for them to come back when everyone else had been served). I am glad it was only a 3-4hr flight.
They need to pay more attention to the customer service and experience.
When are airlines going to enforce the cabin luggage requirements? They did weigh and tag our carry on luggage at bookin but heaps of large luggage made it onto plane.
This is really just a premium economy type seat .
Excellent service in all aspects. Highly recommended.
Bad if you are fat.

Seat width 21", pitch 60". For solo traveler, best seats in business are 2A, 4A, 6A. They offer the most space and privacy. Seat is 180 degree fully flat bed with massage option. Seat is the same as SWISS business seat with light blue decor. Comfortable seat, quiet cabin, service good. Recommendable. Only IFE could improve more with selection of movies. Those were limited. Camera views and route map were good.

The seat on this plane are not width enough specially the aisle seat. Next to that they placed the remote for the entertainment system on the inside off the seat (aisle) And after the wing you have of course a lot off engine noise.
Here is little bIt more space  towards aisle then row 53,good for legs.More noise from the lavatory and service area after meal .

There are 2 business class cabins, in the front cabin there are no overhead lockers in the middle, which makes makes it spacey.  Seat configuration is 1-2-1. As a result all passengers have aisle access. Seats are reasonably wide, can easily be manioulated and are ok when seated.  The seat can be folded to a 180° recline "bed", but the fishbone  structure limits your legroom and the upholstery is not very soft which makes it difficult to sleep.

Nice plane, business class is quite large, no luggage bins on the middle (specific for a350) but large wide bins on the aisles.
Seat was 3A, large enough.
one of my seats compartments was broken and a scotch tape held it closed (on the right)
it is a flatbed, and due to orientation on the side, I had to take a moment before finding the right position to sleep (space for the feet is not so large  on the far end).
everything is convenient, plugs, usb, screen, great entertainment menu, service.

Comparing to Emirates a380 it lacks of : Wide space for the legs,
mini bar (just one water bottle here)
mattress the staff  adds before you go to sleep. remote tablet
but overall, worth the price :-)
I found the plane was not so silent compared to what I read on reviews. Many times I put on and off my NC headset.
absolutely great food and drink choice

Read several reviews by journalists who were invited on introductory flights for 350-900 business class.  They colored their experience immensely.  Perhaps if I reviewed may find the get out clauses.  But, disappointing to an extent.  Service impeccable, food stodgy (this is business  class)  but no shortage of it.  Herringbone seat structure creaky, not very comfortable and seats/bed way too hard.  Lie flat bed surprisingly OK.  Easy to lose seat belt in the mechanism.  Movies rubbish.  Trouble was we had just stepped out of Qantas business class, absolutely no comparison.
Worst plane ever. So outdated. Tiny windows, tiny luggage space (people trying their best to squeeze in luggage), old chairs.

The embraer is a nice place, quiet I used this plane when trying the northraod to go to Asia : from paris to Helsinki then Helsinki to Phuket.
The first plane was from Paris the Embaer
Seat 1A is part of the 3 row of "business class".
Seats are large enough but they fell uncomfortable after 1.5 hour of flight (too hard) like Air Franc Premium eco seats...
Service was great. so as food and champagne.
But there were stains in the carpet....no TVs. seems like an old fleet.
Plenty of room for the legs

Surprisingly comfortable seat at the rear of the plane. My husband was sat in the aisle seat and at over 6ft tall found he had plenty of legroom and we both had elbow room.  The cabin crew were very pleasant and attentive. Two toddlers on the flight cried often and the cabin crew were very helpful and attentive which was so nice to see. All in all an enjoyable experience.

Pleasantly surprised! A very comfortable flight from takeoff to landing. All staff were friendly and helpful. The seats were clean and comfortable for both myself and my husband. Plenty of room around us.
very good but cabin crew is bad
VERY BAD
Seat is kind of missing a window. The same happens with row 10. Actually for both rows, the window is  between seats, with missing window aligned with the rows.

This is NOT the plane we would have expected booking through TUI. Very upset that although we had 2 special assistance booked we had no help before boarding, even when requested! The family was completely split up with the 2 SA's people given seats in row 28!  We did explain this when the seats were allocated at check in and was told to "take it up with your agent" The others were in rows 12 and 1. Disgusting! Generally the plane is dated. There was no food or drink choice brochures in the seat back and didn't know you could request one.  No hot food on board and rolls were dry. Seat was ok, average leg room for economy. 3 items we asked for from duty free were not available, so didn't buy anything. Cabin crew were efficient, although the curtain was drawn for far too long therefore blocking the front toilet. In a nutshell: Disappointing, upsetting flight which seemed a lot longer than it should have been as no family members nearby to talk to. Disappointed with the level of help for special assistance I.e None. Check in staff were offhand. Standard of food and duty free was bad. If I was booking directly I would know what to expect but booking through TUI I expect better!

2nd Nov 2015.This flight consists of 2 legs.1st is Gatwick to Antalya,2nd Antalya to Ercan.for various reasons both legs were delayed by several hours,but poor communication just left us at both airports waiting for any news.Not really acceptable.The seats were comfortable enough for short haul,but need a little extra leg room.recline would have been nice,but due to close proximity of seats any attempt to recline was met with protests from the passenger behind.Apearance and demeanour of staff was good and service was attentive and efficient.No in flight entertainment or information.Apart from seat spacing and poor time keeping this was a fairly pleasant flight.

I can concur with some reviews of Freebird flights I have read.
Hot, stuffy, poor leg room, basic, no entertainment.
The seat I had was cramped so much I was in discomfort from pretty much take off. Horrendous really when you book a Firstchoice package holiday, you dont expect a budget airline....or less than.

LUCKILY.....the return flight Freebird plane was replaced by a Sun Express plane.SO MUCH BETTER, loads more legroom, light modern and airy cabin, just the right ambient temperature. Seat pitch and recline also very good.

Der A320 von TXL nach AYT war ziemlich neu. Aber der A320 TC-FBJ auf dem Rückflug von AYT nach TXL war deutlich älter und klapperte ganz schön bei der Landung.Sitzfreiheit ist mau, fast so schlecht wie bei den Boing 737-800 von easyjet, sun express und pegasus. Außer natürlich in der ersten Reihe sowie an den Notausgängen.Überrascht war ich, dass freebird ein warmes Essen in der Plastikschale servierte, das zwar keine kulinarische Offenbarung war, aber essbar.

despite some reviews pertaining to the A320 we do not have ny negative comments.
everything was all right.
food/drink, entertainment and service are not applicable, but
i mark the with 3 stars
Amazing legroom good recline at least exit row was open.

2D is a 'stretch' seat.  Compared to standard seat, it has extra legroom and a regular sized tray table.  No entertainment screen or charging station.  Overhead bin above seat is reserved for row 1.  Service for food/drink was very good (pay for it), and lots of trash runs.
Im 6ft 235pds and fit snug but comfortably in the aisle seat.  Big bonus, these seats do not recline so no issues with that.  I feel that anyone larger than me should upgrade their seat.

Decent stretch seating. A little hard after 2.5 hours. But much better than the standard seating. Front air much better and fresher. Easy access to lavatory. Full size try table. As opposed to the joke of a tray table you get in a standard seat! Much better and cleaner than Allegiant, Witch isn’t as bad as people make it out to be

I fly often and all airlines 6ft 210lbs.  I like Frontier but if your rich, probably better to fly other airlines.  I accept that Frontier is delayed more than others, no magazines, just water served and seats have less cushion so bring a pillow to sit on if you have a boney butt. (I don't need one)  For the A321,  Almost all seats are OK.  Best seats for tall people over 5'10" are rows 2, 3 and all exit rows, any seat except for 13A and 27F which is still better but has the attendants jump seat  in front of you.  Only problem with 27A and 27F is the tiny round window on the exit door.   Exit seats have dividers which I like to keep people squeezing you out of your seat.  Plenty of width for me, but if you have extremely wide hips, you should choose another airline.  These exit seats all fully recline, which almost all seats on frontier don't recline.  Only problem with exits are the flimsy pull out table.    10E and 26B is a little better because no seat next to you so you can still stretch out sideways.  Worst seats are probably 10B and 26E since attendant jump seat next to you takes up all room so very cramped and no window.   Also rows 40 and 41 are stinky when bathroom door is opened.  Row 1 is really no more room than others since the bulkhead takes up floorspace.

Not designed well for people over 6 ft. I am 6'4" and the top of the seat back hit between my shoulder at neck height which pushed my head forward to an uncomfortable angle.   Seat doesn't adjust after takeoff.  Leg room tight had cramp in my leg near end of flight. My face was within 12 inches of the top of seat in front of me. I have been flying commercially for 30 years and this was the most uncomfortable seat I have ever been in.

In my opinion, there was more than enough legroom. The seat was not the softest but I was comfortable for the four hour flight (even though the seat did not recline). There were drinks and snacks available for purchase but water was free! The crew was very nice and overall I had a great flight!
Great value for price. Stretch seats worked really well for my family. I'm 5'4" and I was able to cross my legs. My sons and husband are all over 6" and had good leg room.
Had nothing but great experience, 1st time ever flying frontier. Very helpful staff at check in
Seat was adequate, on the aisle as requested, upcharge.
Up front seat with my husband in 2C on the aisle. Basically a cheap flight and I got what I paid for.

i'm 176 cm tall and had the worst 4.5 hr trip,
no leg room and almost impossible to use arm rest.
never again

Travelled with my 15 year old granddaughter on 7th April on Jetstar Dreamliner from Sydney to Honolulu.  Nine and a half hours of misery.  Paid extra for upfront seats assuming families with kids would not pay the extra.  Wrong!   Baby of about 12 months was in the row in front and yelled hysterically on and off throughout the entire night.  It's two sibling joined in about 4am and squealed and talked and laughed for the rest of the trip.  Scoot does not allow babies and young children in it's quiet zone up front - Jetstar should do the same.
The journey was not comfortable because the seats were too narrow and not enough room between the rows.  We felt very restricted.
Touch screen entertainment was good with a reasonable choice of movies.  Aircraft was a lot quieter than any others I have travelled on.  Would like to fly on the Dreamliner again with a full service airline with better seating configuration.

Row 10 is extra money but a lot of leg room. Seat arms are immoveable and Jetstar seats are not wide but I still prefer to be squished horizontally rather than in leg room. 10 ABC had bassinet so avoid that.
The flight was cancelled at 2:00 am. I awoke at 7:00 am to the task of finding a quick flight to Phuket. Luckily I was able to book on Thai Airways departing at 10:00 AM
A comfortable seat at the bulkhead not recommended for person over 180cm footrest was quite stiff hard to unfold and fold overhead light excellent Would have preferred row 2 or similar
Standard seat. Plenty of leg room. Loved the window as I could dim it during a sunny period. Seat reclines and tray table was fine.

This plane is so advanced.
Flew with Jetstar from Melbourne to Cairns.
Exit seat, window.
Quiet, spacious and cool manual adjustment of the window dimmer.
Best ever !!
tHE MOST COMFORTABLE AND ENJOYABLE LONG HAUL FLIGHT IN MY LIFE. I AM OBESE AND LOVED THIS SEAT
good flight but running late
Perfect flight from the beginning to the end ,, no complaints here
Comfortable seat and friendly cabin crew

The seats in the business class is very outdated. The flight was for 7hours 30 min and the seats would recline a little and the leg rest was manual and would come up just a little bit. The service was good however, I could not sleep. No individual monitors. I could barely see the movie which they had turned on the 3 monitors they have in the total business class. I would never travel on this again. I would either go via a Middle East airlines or by Ethiopian which is much better. The tkt was very expensive and really not worth the money. If at all I have to travel I would choose economy class and save as it looked decent.

The seat was ok, a bit outdated and for a nightflight not the best to have. Service was very good, did not try the food, but it looked good and was tasty according to the enthusiasm of my fellow pasengers.

Staff is lovely but just flew 14+ hours business class from Accra to Dakar (via Nairoi) without individual screen or tablet provided for entertainment. This flight was overpriced compared to the available amenities and overall comfort.

The Boeing 737-700 from Nairobi to Dakar was even worse as this one was a 9-hour flight without even a power outlet (not business friendly for those that need to work on the plane). KQ should advise their customers at the time of booking as the absence of such basic features is just unacceptable nowadays..
The flight between Lagos and Nairobi was comfortable except that the inflight screen was above passengers head and we had to keep looking up to see the screens. It was also not video on demand.
Extremely comofortable aircraft, KQ has all leather configurationDon't waste your money in Business Class, try to get exit row 18 (Y class stars at 11)it's good.
Had a comfortable flight. Seats were comfortable, however for a longer flight I had wished to have more legroom.
EXIT SEAT; ROOM FOR LEGSBRAND NEW AIRPLANE GOOD VIDEO SCREEN AND CHOICE OF MOVIES

excellent leg room, white wall in front of you. the wall being used for couples with babies, so you could be next to a baby or be moved to accomidate one, this happened to the person in 30d on my flight, he was given a pair of seat in economy comfort in exchange. Only negatives are, can get bumped by persons on way to or from toilet, and you have to errect your own video screen and food table. The legroom is more than that of an economy comfort seat. So my advice is book a seat along this row and save on the upgrade cost to economy comfort, which was 160euro for my flight, but didnt see many taking it on the day.

Con: there is a metallic box under the seat in front, it takes almost half the width of your legroom. I've noticed a similar box under "21D". 22B didn't have any box . I didn't check if all "A" and "D" seats have the box, or only some rows.
The entertainment system uses remote control (no touchscreen), is very user unfriendly. I found the choice of movies quite poor (the number of movies is Ok, but couldn't find an interesting one), and no news channel.

Business Class:I had heard that the KLM seats in Business Class were awkward when in the lay flat position; and I agree. What I ended up doing was putting the seat in the recliner position and then did individual controls for the foot and back. Put the massage on and slept for 6 hours. As everyone else has mentioned; the KLM staff are incredible!

Realy good airliner! i flown several airliners but this one is on the top. on my flight was a great staff. the legroom can better but it's good enough and i'm 1,90cm tall. the inflight entertainment was very good. the food was also very tastefull for airplane norms. and we arived early on our destination and that is most important of all.

This seat has an IFE box below the chair in front of it which restricts the leg room. This is quite annoying on a long haul flight of 8.5 hours. Further food is okay for an airliner. Comfort Level is low. Should be time that KLM expands legg room in there entire Economy class.

Not to pick on KLM over others, but legroom is desperately inadequate on these and most planes. My wife is 5'7" and her knees ached through most of the 8-hour flight. Seat-back video with good selection of films and games is a useful distraction...but I'd rather take the train.

Window Seat quite small ,not much bigger than economy for THE price difference.Some of THE staff friendly and helpful One sour and bitchy,period? Food was ok ,breakfast excellent.Lookat Icelandair air for service.
Never again. Arrogant staff. Flight crew looked shabby. Comfort level is low. Schiphol is ok but prefer Frankfurt, London or Copenhagen.
Worst long haul seating I've ever seen. There's in IFE box under A, J, and F seats that restricts the legroom as well.
Nice set, plenty of legroom, a window seat with easy access to theaisle. A litlle bit narrow. Professional staff, although not particularly friendly

Great flight and great service. The seat does not recline all the way, but is quite comfortable overall. Personally, I did not recline my seat to the max, as I dd not find it comfortable to sleep that way. Instead, I found an in between position that was good for me. My neighbour, on the other hand slept with his seat reclined to the max and seemed quite comfortable. Food was excellent!

I contacted KLM and they they will be installing the new "Diamond" business class seats on their A330s this year and next.

Very comfortable and spacious seating.  Only comment is the lack of storage space for small electrical items.  Some airlines I have travelled with, have a cupboard to store personnel item in at the seat.
Really enjoyed the flight, seat was comfortable for both sitting and sleeping.. Food service very well presented and tastefull

Excellent seat in the Economy Comfort zone. A lot of space for your legs. Also there is more seat recline than in economy. Food and drink is very poor, but okey for the short distance.  Ans also there is no entertainment at this European flight. The cabin crew is very kind.
Very good plane. Very spacious, at least in Business class. Just avoid the aisle seats in the front row.
Good legroom, comfortable aisle seat,

Nothing special really. Economy class starts somewhere between row 4 and 10, depending on the number of Europe Select (´Business Class´) seats in use. Rows 1-10 (and the exit rows) have slightly more legspace, and a power supply. 8A, 9A and 9F don´t have a window.

Prima vlucht, de service was uitstekend.  Heel fijn dat er opgemerkt werd dat mijn moeder minder goed ter been is en er zo goed voor haar gezorgd werd. De snack bleken twee lekkere sandwiches, we waren aangenaam verrast.
Very uncomfy and I didn't like it. I felt claustrophobic because the aircraft is tiny. The seats are very uncomfy. Anyway, I won't be flying KLM or (hopefully) on a boeing aircraft again!
I was traveling with a cat (first time ever). The KLM personnel was very kind and healpfull.
Window seat, over the wing, view slightly restricted because of the wing. Generally a normal economy seat.

When I purchased my tickets, I specifically asked the Northwest Airlines ticket agent for an exit row seat when I went to retrieve my tickets and passes. Of course, I flew this flight long before airlines started asking customers to pay for exit-row seats. I flew in this same seat round trip between Los Angeles and Schiphol and while most people aren't too happy with having an emergency exit with a very bulky box within their leg space, the flight attendants didn't mind my using the door as a foot rest, since I am a broad-shouldered 6'-4" tall and there was NO place for me to put my long legs without bothering my neighbor. Considering the tray table is in the armrest, which makes this seat a tad smaller than I like, it was still a comfortable place to sit on a crowded flight of 9.5 and 10.5 hours each way.While I flew aboard this aircraft twelve years ago in 2003, I still remember the fabulous service! Every time I thought I was getting thirsty or hungry, the flight attendants were coming by with trays of water, orange juice, very hot towels, meals, or snacks. The meals weren't terrible, I was pleasantly surprised to have dinner and breakfast on both legs of my trip. Of course, being one of the first passengers off the plane isn't too shabby. One of the boarding doors is directly across from this seat at both Los Angeles AND Schiphol.The entertainment could have been better, but only because passengers were constantly congregating in front of the lavatories blocking my view of the one screen the six of us in rows 21- and 22-HJK were viewing. The galleys are rather close, but KLM's flight attendants are VERY conscientious about working quietly and not disturbing nearby passengers most of whom were sleeping.

My one downfall with this seat is that you do not have your own airflow control or area to stow your bag overhead, so if you get hot easily on flights or mind putting your bag in a bin across from your seat, I would reconsider this one. The service was wonderful, the food tasted good, and you got to deplane before the general passengers through exiting through the kitchen. Our entertainment system stopped working for about 30 minutes, but they fixed that. One of the bathrooms was out of order for about an hour or two too for our section of business class, but they fixed that too.

Aside from the fact that my much hated boss was sitting three rows ahead of me, this was a pleasant flight. I sat on the upper deck outwards and on the lower deck return.  Seat 4E was very pleasant as I could see out of both sets of portholes with ease and had no one in front of me.  The seat is not very comfortable for a J class product, but as this is only a 3 hour flight, it was not a hardship.  Service was crisp, cheerful efficient and cohesive.  Meals were tasty and served with a smile.

4A is a standard KLM business class seat but being a single seat it offers indeed a lot of space and privacy.  Without the proximity of any toilets or gantries if also is a very quite area.  Definately one of the better seats in the plane. The (new) KLM business seat itself is ok but not as good as many other airlines (Emirates/ Singapore, etc).  Same applies for service, in general good but overall not as perfect as many others especially considering the KLM price level.

Bussiness class seats are not as comfortable or spacious as in other airlines, perhaps, service offered is great and food is also quite tasty. Look at the picture to have a better idea about the seats.

The seat overall is one of the best I've ever met. The entertainment is excellent; you can do whatever you want with your personal screen! There are a lot of movies and games on there, and there is music too! The food is pretty good compared to other airlines, and the service of KLM is always excellent!

My husband and I had seats 9B and 9C... The seats are incredibly narrow, due to the fact that the tray table and scream are both inside the armrest. I am not overweight and I could barely fit in the seat. (We paid extra for this horrible seat because it is in the "Economy Comfort" section!)

I thought the whole experience was great, from check in, to the club and the flight. The seat was very comfortable and the service was unbeatable. Am sitting upstairs on the way back. I will post that experience but I expect it to be no different.

Great experience. I especially liked the storage next to my seat between my seat and the outside wall. There was lots of room for all of the items I brought on board that I needed to get at. The service was outstanding.

Best intercontinental flight  yet! Loved this KLM 747-400 ( cargo) aircraft configuration. Enconomy comfort section was great. Appreciated a mini tour of this interesting aircraft by the senior purser! A shame they will decommission this plane in a few years.

I saw all the reviews beforehand about the lack of service, seat comfort etc. and found this to NOT be true for us on this flight.  The extra room seats costing $100.00 more per seat while a joke in price is so worth the extra money for that long a flight.  I wish ALL airlines could go back to the more comfortable seating, for this flight we paid it and were thankful.  The service was very, very good and very attentive without being pushy.  We flew over to Europe in regular coach on American and KLM is such a much better way to fly.  I will definitely consider KLM again as they were notthe way the many reviews before we flew were talking about...at least for this flight.  I have been flying for 65 years and believe I have a lot of miles and experience to measure the service and comfort and KLM..in this climate...you passed with a good flight!
